ohlv6ojZA4iBpWfAh34T-g.text: Flavors of India serves up a decent lunch buffet.  I've been there a couple of times though and it seems some days, the food is better than others.  Also, I wish they offered a bit more selection.  I've teetering between a 3 and 4 star but because of the reasonable price and friendly service, I'm bumping up to a 4 star.  I'll have to go again to make a final decision.   See ya there!

SqWRjwECPgws9OT8UpI0cg.text: Very good tasting buffet with variety! Ambiance and atmosphere is great. Attentive service as well. Did I say the food is good? Yes!

wUXysFGwBF24mXee7-EI7A.text: Absolutely the best in Phoenix - my opinion.   Try the yellow Dal, Chicken Biryani and Aloo Mutter in medium.   You can thank me later!

UkSPMhLmjwK7g44gBKsCrg.text: Last night 9/19/2015 was the second time I had eaten here. The first time was a long time ago and I remember the food was good, the staff as being a bit rude and the restaurant itself was a bit warm inside.  Last night was wonderful all the way around.  Upon entry we were warmly greeted, exchanged pleasantries and were promptly seated. We got our waters and bread quite quickly and our orders were taken shortly there after. I got the chicken tikka and my partner got the lamb vindaloo we shared some garlic naan. The dining room was not crowded as it was only about 45 minutes to closing time. We received our food in an average amount of time and it was TOTALLY delicious, the portions were large and I have NOTHING negative to say about my most recent visit. In fact it will become a regular in my restaurant rotation due to its incredibly convenient location. Don't pass this place up.

oMeUFkHST5uv9wSYV9zOGg.text: What can I say. The ambiance is fantastic. The restaurant is clean. The service is friendly.  And the food...spectacular. I prefer going during lunch for the buffet...which is a rarity for me, since I typically loathe buffets. But this restaurant's buffet is packed full of flavorful choices; from the chicken to the vegetable or potato pakoras.   On the dinner menu, my first choice is the chicken vindaloo. Just superb.   On a side note, you should check out their music videos playing on the two tv screens. (Again, this is against the grain for me, since I usually loathe and rant about any restaurant with tv!) Sometimes the videos are so lurid that they're addicting to watch! They're all the same with the same theme: Man falls in love with girl. Girl dances and acts coy. Man sings to woo her. Man gets girl. The end. lol  Flavors of India is a gem. Lunch or dinner, this is the place to go.

4QG-ltqz-snPCcUgc7ehYA.text: Best Indian food in Phoenix for sure! Our favorite is the Chicken Korma or Tikka Masala and Naan. My folks were in town and my dad loved it so much, we only ate lunch here for the week, seriously. It is a family-run business and they've treated us well and know us by name, which I love.

OXJ87eAb6CgzwlYGuF4vBw.text: Honestly, I have very minimal experience with Indian food so I have little to compare it to.... BUT a friend and I decided to venture out and snag something new. Honestly, the food we had was amazing. I was upset I got full because I wanted to keep eating. And the people there were not overly intrusive by constantly coming up to us and asking how it was. Attentive without being overwhelming.   I came away with two thoughts: 1. Why am I not Indian so I can make this confidently at home? 2. How has it taken me 24 years to consume something so delightful?  Overall we both had a great time and can't wait to go again.

GUt21x8FXMlgaxO7-ReK9w.text: Y'know, I had to give myself a while to get over the figurative gastronomical blue balls I suffered at the hands of Flavors of India.  So here's the scoop.  I'm a business guy. This place isn't much to look at from the outside and there weren't but a couple of cars outside. They've a banner touting their differentiating advantage... "Ice cold Coca Cola served here."  Ok, you have Coke..grand.  1965 is jealous.  But I loooove Indian food & even though I couldn't tell if they served alcoholic beverages, specifically Indian beers, from the online menu (they do) we throw caution to the wind & go on anyway.  We could always leave, right?    So upon entering we're immediately seized by the most pleasant aroma... Imagine the aroma scent finger seducing you to scarf down the big steaks like in Tom and Jerry.   Seriously, I saw that. It smelled delicious.   The gentleman who greeted us was pleasant and I assume the owner.  I've driven by here dozens of times and like I said, I seldom see more than a couple cars here.  Today was no different.  There were a total of 5 tables being occupied.  The people at 2 were eating and 2 were wrapping up in idle chatter.  At first I figured the lone server, who I figured to be the owner's wife as they were close in age, was simply being conscientious in not wanting to rush us to order.  After she passed our table a half dozen times and managed to avoid the eye contact we tried to connect with, we were able to ask what the really good looking food the couple at the booth next to us was.  Maybe it was my imagination, but the answers was curt and she seemed slightly annoyed. Again, as a business person I'd be excited.  Clue: those are buying signals.  We'd been there 10 minutes or so now and hadn't ordered.  Again, there are just 5 booths/tables occupied and all are nestled together in a tight cluster and I'm situated between two of them.  After another 4 or 5 passes from 1 to 3 and skipping me at table two, I wave, say "excuse me" and the lady puts up the "hold on finger" before I finally get her to let me order a beer and appetizers.  Clue: I'm buying alcohol and appetizers, we're polite and well coifed.  We may be a good table.  The sales guy in me is screaming inside at her inattention by now.  After 25+ minutes and having not been able to order an entree in a relatively empty place, it's a wrap. I ask for the check.  They tell me they were changing over their oil to explain delay. What's that got to do with paying attention to a customer? Nada.  I take the samosas to go and head to one of my fav restaurants instead.  It's a shame really, because I ate one of those samosas in the car and it was damned good. I mean, it was frickin' delicious and I suspect the solid reviews they've had on food would hold up. If only these guys could get selected to go on Bar Rescue to learn to attract and keep new customers.

r5n6D2dQlWhi-Nju460oWQ.text: Definitely my favorite Indian place in the area. Everything I've had has been delicious. You can't go wrong. Samosas, veggie or chicken, tikki masala, vindaloo. It's all been amazing!

1Q5CH3EKlZBRMuYSCnq1ww.text: Worst Indian in the entire phoenix valley, the lunch buffet had only one chicken dish, one meat, one daal, one vegetable, are you kidding me and nothing was exceptional, it was just average. Not at all good and value for money, Compare the menu with Chutneys on baseline and Ray.  I will never come back again.

E-r2XB5NL7-PhhHga9_S6Q.text: This is a great place to drop in for a quick lunch.  Everything is served buffet style, so you can arrive and immediately start eating.  I would give 5 stars, but the service is super slow and getting some naan bread brought to your table can be a chore.

hH_RoLI4-uJzDIgA3LdQ4Q.text: Great lunch buffet! It feels authentic with music and decor. Staff have always been very helpful and warm.

8hYeDaw0kyVyRngoDqdKzQ.text: If not for the slow naan bread delivery this would most certainly be a 5 star review. The food is delicious and for the price it can not be beat. The lunch buffet is always a smart choice and I feel I have to specifically point out how fresh and insanely tasty the naan bread is. I would come here for that alone.

9CXjZpQNenSpSH1e3t_WRA.text: I would not go back to this place.  The mixed grill was horrible, very little flavor and chicken was very dry.  The manager there stated it was because the chicken is white meat...have never heard that before and have been to many places where the chicken is white meat and yet very tender and juicy.  I asked for the lamb grill instead, and was disappointed again.  Staff was friendly but the food was not good, I left both grill orders uneaten.

wkYzPpeC4J7Nn3yTnqkong.text: One of the best Indian buffets in the valley.  Love their chicken makhani (butter chicken). It makes an appearance on their buffet table fairly frequently (as much as i love tikka masala, it's a nice change). Their naan, palak paneer, and chana masala are all perfect cooked and seasoned.   Service is quick and friendly. One of my favorite spots to go for lunch. Go now:)

vg8zJQ6-6QogOQMd9uDomA.text: Ate here a few times and the food was good. Then on our last visit we opened our menus and baby roaches fell out.... NOPE!  haven't been back since.

0FvosoIyG1ZRvNtnUQJnSQ.text: Not bad for lunch buffet.  Limited options. The sag chicken was quite good. Rice pudding had a different spice to it. Not sure I loved it. The chicken Makhani was good. Found the mushroom mutter to be a surprise. Nice and spicy. Tasty.

g4HDOZZp-ncH0GhQ6OWzBQ.text: I said goodbye to a good friend over lunch at the best East Indian buffet in Phoenix, Flavors of India (4515 North 16th Street, Phoenix, AZ 85016). The buffet menu, which is known to change throughout the week, consisted of Basmati Rice, Tandori Chicken, Chicken Masala, Chicken Curry, various vegetable dishes containing spinach, lentils, potatoes, onion, fresh tomatoes and green beans, fried green chilies, mint chutney and Naan Bread. The menu items were served from traditional copper pots. This exquisitely flavorful lunch was capped off with fresh mango pudding and fried yogurt balls in cardamom-infused rice pudding for dessert. The staff provided exceptional service, even though the lunch was buffet style. The facilities were clean and presented an atmosphere of Indian culture. Parking was readily available.

oCY44di9qghBM5GD3UOAPg.text: Small buffet with some OK dishes. I thought the chick peas were cooked well and flavored nicely. The chicken curry was spicy but executed poorly. The rice in the buffet line was old. The fresh naan was nice but we were ready to leave by the time they brought it to our table, which made the meal all the more sad. Not coming back.

4fh0lIpre_OejM7rKXJS2w.text: My mother and I had their lunch buffet.   The restaurant was comfortable and well-decorated-- a nice break from the asphalt and traffic outside.  The food was flavorful and delicious.  I especially liked the spinach and the chicken curry.   The rice was well done.  The staff were friendly and courteous.

IzBbP5Og0dF5hzrJ97cq7g.text: First time dining here. This review is strictly in regards to their dinner menu and not for their buffet. Personally in my experience, I've never enjoyed any Indian food buffet I've ever tried. Starting off, our party of 3 found the service to be very inviting and gracious. They really had a family business vibe. The cook, which I assumed to be the dad or patriarch, personally helped to deliver food to the table. We ordered the sampler (non-vegetarian) platter for an app which consisted of 2 chicken samosas, 4 chicken pakoras, and 4 shrimp pakoras. Delicious! Do not let the description of the pakoras defer you from order it. "deep fried fritters" yet they do not taste oily and the batter is made from scratch! For entrees, we ordered the sag chicken, lamb vindaloo, and paneer masala. Overall we liked the sag chicken the most because we thought the vindaloo could have been spicier (we requested 8/10 spice level). The sag was requested to be 10/10 spice and still wasn't up to par but made up for it due to its delicious flavor. We ordered the garlic naan and the peshwari naan. Garlic naan was a hit with the whole table. The peshwari naan was still decent (had coconut shavings inside which we thought to be a bit odd). Everyone had leftovers which definitely was a welcomed surprise. We do not know when we will be back but I know we will be sometime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6CVXHrJjnZLiDZZVjmeKfw.text: Very good spicy curry and rice. Great mango lassi (yogurt smoothie) as well. Very friendly staff. Highly recommended.

45KsbbyA4_rSl8FtHLiNeg.text: My favorite dish at this restaurant is Chole Bhature. The yummy garbanzo bean dish with the amazing puffed bread (Bhature) is soooo good. Add a glass of mango lassi,and you have a perfect meal, and I always have quite a bit leftover to take home and share, or enjoy later. The people who run this restaurant are always kind, and they ask how spicy you like it. I want the chole between medium and mild. I tried medium, and it was a little too hot for my Nordic taste buds. Even at the relatively low spice level that I get, I still need the mango lassi to help cool the fire! And it is all sooo good! It wouldn't be as good without a little spicy heat! :D Best of all, even my vegetarian friends can enjoy this dish! I love this restaurant and the sweet people who run it!

h49l699tCq3YiT86o22gHw.text: This appears to be a family owned restaurant.  The food is very very good.  I had the lunch buffet.  It didn't have as much variety as some, but everything I tasted was fantastic.  They could make my review a 5 star review by communicating a little better.  Two suggestions:  1.  When you seat someone, ask them if they are there for the buffet.  If they are, tell them to pick up a plate and start.  2.  Sometime during the lunch, let the customer know that they just need to pay at the register when they are done.  I waited for a check that wasn't coming.

w1HKnKqJqOP4mDlb8Ai_tw.text: If Buffet was $8 I could say yes as the food is good enough, but at $12 it is too small and choice very limited.....okay if you live or work down the street but not worth a long drive.  I also notice that they never charge tax  and do not give a receipt if you pay the $12 tab in cash so it is obvious they are skimming off the books.  LOL...

SNxcBEAsdjcf_NmxNbl59w.text: Really loved the papadum they served as the bread! I have a wheat allergy so this a huge perk for me.  We ordered the rice and aloo Chloe as well as chicken tikka Masala and Lam vindaloo.  We like spice, so 7 was a perfect level for the chicken & lamb.  For the appetizer we ordered the onion Bhaji; if you like onion rings, go for it! Delicious.  The service was gentle and attentive and we had a wonderful evening.  Try this place!!

JiTzJ0lQxXXDcbSIA_g3jw.text: By far the best Indian food in the Valley! I can't believe I haven't written a review yet. My boyfriend and I get take out at least a few times a month even though we live no where near the restaurant. We always get chicken tikka masala and garlic naan. The sauce is perfectly creamy and tomato-y. Like, I literally want to call and thank them every time for an amazing dinner.   Went once for lunch buffet, but they had dark meat chicken for their tikka masala and I'm not a fan, but I get why they do it. White meat is used for dinner orders and always perfectly cooked. Yum!!!!! Staff is always so friendly and mango lassi is a must as well.

kS4r25K9tYPvXRyWB8niVg.text: We have been coming here for a couple years now. The Buffett, takeout and sit down. There is always a smile with the service and the food is too notch. We have noticed how good and fresh the spices are. Defiantly check them out!

QWUSpiH-eDsaEkkjrQLZ1g.text: Love their buffet. Owner is very polite and welcoming.  Food is great. Price is reasonable Must try Chola curry, naan roti, kheer and gulabjamun. Meat dishes are the best

LaHA8Rs1Sqv-sQY5Hzfxmw.text: Wish I could give them negative 5 they have the worst service and inferior food quality... I found this place on DOOR-DASH and decided to give them a shot...in a nutshell no forks no napkins no rice...and when I called to find out what happened no respect....so that means NO BUSINESS from me or any one I know... they're to many great Indian restaurants in Phoenix to compromise and eating here is definitely a compromise!!!

B_I7cI9yrmbI_e3sQYq07w.text: I'm surprised by the reviews, only because I found the food to be very bland. The naan was burnt and I couldn't taste any spices. The staff was friendly, I liked the decor and the music was fun. I think next time I'm skipping the buffet and trying a plate from the menu.

7FvHsq0ddFKwqjIK_Q_VSw.text: I eat a lot of Indian food. This place just doesn't cut it. Recently I was here and ordered my usual chicken tikka masala and asked for it HOT! Well, what came out was more like an over sugared tomato sauce. It was almost inedible. When we approached the server to tell her it was too sweet she tried to tell us that "that's the way tikka masala tastes". Ummmm, negatory good buddy. Nice try though.   We also got lamb korma and the meat was really, really tough. Sauce was decent.   For what you get and the price (side note: why the H is Indian food so expensive?!?) it's not worth it.   I don't recommend this restaurant. There are too many other amazing Indian places in the Phx area. You money and time are better spent elsewhere.

ux8pDH8fo5rLZEUBuK_ZyA.text: This is in reality a 4.5 rating. Very friendly service, just based on that I will be going back. Buffet: Best tandoori chicken, very juicy. I'm not eating bread, but temptation got me  and it was by far the best naan I've had. Fresh selection, except for the fried section, it seems it needs a better heat chute.  Update: I went back to this place, I'm not changing my stars, and I feel bad because the lady in charge is so nice. My comment has to do with one of the guys taking care of the food. He was probably sick and he was walking around replenishing trays, clearing his throat loudly, without covering his mouth. That made me uncomfortable, plus it's unhealthy. I hope they address the issue.

03V5dY9WquvV5Pdkh54UEA.text: Ordered delivery for food but turned out disappointing. Ordered naan and paneer tikka masala but the confusing menu meant it was paneer tikka dry and not paneer tikka masala with curry that you eat with the bread and the naan-bread was also very very thick. Samosa was decent. Might be a for dine in but i wouldn't recommend for delivery.

9ztAsD90EbXf--iW67vluQ.text: One of the best Indian lunch buffets I've had in a long time with all the favorites! The owner said that the buffet selections change every few days.  I will DEFINITELY be back!

QalsRyFUbAZkUnq_Dr_sWg.text: Very good authentic Indian cuisine.  We had  a chicken dish an lamb curry.   Choose your level of heat - we had 4.   Friendly service.

hG925BppUXjIz7GKCBh-Bg.text: A wonderful new discovery. The buffet is exceptional in addition to the extensive menu. Each item is prepared and served with care and attention to detail. You are treated like a long awaited friend. As a bonus, they proudly sell Kingfisher beer to compliment their complex flavors. Stop in and get happy

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3dpWdcfdnwvpilugX3JLvQ.text: Lunch buffet! This place is delish all made from scratch. The only Indian place I will travel to from Gilbert. If you love Indian food, please stop by here during lunch it's $11 and it's amazing.

L77LZeU2EYQtr7FqjKHRyw.text: Came here a week ago and this was a return visit, and as always they do great.   For a small mom and pop place, this is a great restaurant that has an amazing selection of Indian food.   I come here and have no expectations of a fine dining or amazing service, but I always get it. The food was awesome and the Naan bread is to die for. they check on us enough to make sure we are doing okay but they do not over do it, so it is appreciated.   Our waiter was good, not talkative or welcoming, but got the work done, and I was fine with that. The hostess who I believe is the owner or wife of the owner is very friendly and asked about how we were doing and how we enjoyed the food.  I definitely recommend it, and make sure when they ask you how spicy you want, go with medium, it is still spicy enough to enjoy the flavors and the spiciness.

pQw_xjkii8HRcv_1gQq7MQ.text: I order from here via Amazon delivery and the food has always been amazing. Today I actually decided to eat in and was completely blown away. The food is made to order and is served piping hot and fresh. I honestly did not think the food could get better than when I had it delivered, but it did. I am absolutely thrilled that I found this place.

R3A7O9JnrXUXxTQLC9ekag.text: These one star reviews don't ring True to me and my wife. We LOVE this place.  Great service and food, period. It's a little pricey, but not horrible.

7i83tB8n1IMaAzhhZzqLog.text: Sorry, should have gotten to this review; because I am a fan of this restaurant.  Love the Rice Pilao; every time must get this dish.  All the curry dishes are great; especially for someone who dines with people who either don't like spicy or crave spicy dishes; they will adjust to your taste.  Been here about 5-6 different times every time left very satisfied and ready to go back.

mZK2dhWMuvqEvBF0_dQW0g.text: I am a big fan of Indian food albeit an unadventurous one.  I always get the Chicken Korma.  The creaminess of the korma just soothes my soul, especially when it is the right amount of spicy.  And there is garlic naan to be had.  I have been to Flavors three times now and each time I have left with the best kind of fire in my belly and smile across my face.  This place is almost never crowded and the service is pretty decent.  They play Bollywood movies for an added cultural effect.

LS7Vi6i4eL6VlnGOGBLzqA.text: I have been here a few times, but mainly at dinner.  Dinner Has always been great, great waiters and staff, with a LCD TV playing almost famous famous bolywood movies.  LOL  It cracks me up when they dance.....LOL...anyhow, Great vegetarian choices for people who eat there veggies, but trust me, I am a MEAT eater,  Chicekn Tika masala, Little dry but still good.  My favorite is there Palak Paneer. Great for the vegetarian.  I have also tried there lunch Buffet for 11.00.  I give a Thumbs up..  Good, serve yourself, and pig out!!!!!!

ew8oqqho7oTd913WExO1MA.text: I love Indian food although I cannot eat it everyday since the spices and my stomach don't get along very well. But when I do get my monthly Indian fix it better be good taking into consideration the next couple of won't be pleasant for me. Flavors of India does the trick for me and their food and flavors are awesome and unique.  Keep up the good work guys.

Baiua3C4MC6MCdnQhhMe1w.text: Lamb tikki masala and garlic naan are delicious. I try to come at least once every couple weeks for lunch. Great food every time and the owner and his wife are hands on and very kind. Definitely recommend this place.

-7trrMPv7moMQwiCE4wuSQ.text: Was in the area and hit this place for lunch today. Every thing was very good, especially the nan which was brought to my table fresh and hot.  I have eaten here many times before but not lately. Some days they have stuff I like better than other days but it is always pretty good.

bsawxZAB04Qtm-h_P7Yi6A.text: I used to eat here all the time. It's been a hot minute. Today having lunch at their once great lunch buffet was horrid. The rice was dry and crunchy. The food was of poor quality. The tomato chicken tasted like beef jerky . On top of all that the services was horrid. I had to actually get up from the table and walk over to the bar were there was 5 waiters standing around and talking to ask for a refill of soda. They acted like it was such a bother and barely said two words to us. Never going back again

Wb1btfe1ZYyZGaIhUIzT4g.text: I have been CRAVING Indian food lately and after hearing about FOI from a coworker and reading the reviews here, I decided to try it out for lunch. Ok it is a buffet, I knew that, but I have been to some very good Indian buffets. When I walk into any ethnic restaurant and I see people of the same ethnicity of the restaurant eating there I get excited. It must be good right?   This table must have been family and eat for free because I have had better. The naan was just ok, the Tandoori chicken, meh (well I have never been a big fan of this anyway because almost anywhere it is usually just dry bland chicken to me). The butter chicken type dish with tomatoes, was ok but looked like they added red food coloring. I enjoyed the flavor of the meatball dish, the palak dish was bland. Honestly the only other dish I found interesting other than the meatballs was the Carrot "pudding" which was sauteed sweet minced carrots, went back twice just for that. The sweet rice was ok, it had raisins and coconut.  I generally prefer it without either.  I may go try it one more time and order off the menu for dinner. Give it a fair chance before completely ruling it out.

Qjlsqvr5TzNVPiztO_Bfkw.text: This was my first time here. It was a nice experience.. And I found that I really like Indian food ! Good stuff !

X77lJwIz-s12qoBsQotrFA.text: This isnt the most imaginative Indian buffet, but I like it for several reasons. Reasonably tasty fare, pleasant buffet service and AYCE prices around $9-10, but what I really appreciate is the subdued and somewhat elegant atmosphere, just a quarter mile south of the big do on Camelback.   There's a ton of busy Camelback restaurants, but it seems the choice is often between fast food, pizza or pricey event dining in the Biltmore or Esplanade. Flavors of India provides a relaxing, comfortable middle ground - sit down dining with real china and stemware at very affordable prices. That fills a niche this area needs.    Everybody forgets this place is right around the corner. It's rarely crowded and there's something comforting about getting out of the sun and the bustle and settling into FOI's dark environs for a leisurely Indian meal. The drink service. The naan. Chafing dishes being replenished. It's a gentle rhythm that suits me and nothing seems hurried like the corporate factories up the street. The people here seem to appreciate that you went a little out of your way to stop in, too.  I always leave feeling I've gotten my money's worth, and frankly, a little rejuvenated.   If you live in Mesa, I dont recommend making a special trip to find FOI.  It's not that good. But if you're in the neighborhood, stressed out from shopping and traffic, it's a soothing alternative, a bit off the beaten path.

blYDl51gpv1Z_0_J2LscbA.text: On occasion I crave Indian food. This is not the best, nor the worst I've had but I too concur that FOI isn't at the same level as it has been in the past. The servers and preparers are exceptionally polite and lovely, but the food was not as flavorful and savory and I remember. As I pick at the mango pudding and the carrot pudding (which seems like a dessert that is sweetened and full of butter) I will go over the highlights and lowlights of my culinary adventure- I enjoyed the spinach/cheese mixture; one of my go to dishes. The chicken tikka was ok, and the tandoori chicken was a "B". On the flip side, the assorted fritters had seen fresher days and the vegetarian/cabbage dish was not very flavorful, IMHO even with the big caraway seeds. The seeds were huge - to the point I was routinely picking them from my dish. Kudos to Yelp which enabled me to have another helping of mango pudding as I write this. Seeing how there are/were several Indian diners here, it can't be too bad.

HfWsZvS2T5lFZeNcdOjMDQ.text: This was the Indian restaurant I would often frequent when I lived in Phoenix. The three stars I give this place reflects my mixed feelings about it. I tend to gravitate to Indian restaurants that offer excellent lunch buffets, as it gives you the opportunity to sample multiple dishes. The buffet offered at Flavors of India is just okay, but often a little on the bland side. I do enjoy their samosas, vegetable pakoras, and tandoori chicken, but most of the entrees offered at the buffet are underwhelming. The story changes, however, when you order items from the menu and ask for them on the spicy side. Their mutter paneer and aloo gobi are excellent and nicely spiced. My personal favorite here is the baigan bharta, which is spicy fire-roasted eggplant with onions and peas. The taste of it is just out of this world. This is a great place for take-out, where you can order items to your specifications.

je7dDdFovfpgsk9BI9ketA.text: Wide range of vegetarian options. Great chicken tikka masala! Very friendly and attentive staff. If you're into Bollywood, this place plays videos too.

PeKlKZuHfeIlwFUbvYdndQ.text: I only stopped in for takeout.  The employees were very helpful and attending while I waited.  The restaurant was slow to middlin' for a Friday evening - but the smell was mouthwatering from the parking lot.  My food was fantastic and the nice sized portions ($11 or so for my meal, plus rice and nan) afforded me lunch the following day.  We'll definitely be back for more!

8UMV9Mnu_dsMPLuaKcCJOg.text: I woke up late on a Saturday, and I was craving Indian food! To my relief, it was almost lunch time! I remembered that there was an Indian restaurant close to me that I had been meaning to try. I headed to Flavors of India to try their lunch buffet. I walked in and I was immediately greeted. I noted the Bollywood videos playing in the background, I love those dang videos. The host was also my waiter. He invited me to help myself to the buffet. I'm not one of those people that knows the names of each and every dish. As I write this I'm kicking myself for not taking notes. As a whole, the buffet was a-ok. Nothing in particular knocked my socks off. I did notice that nothing was powerfully flavorful. It was kind of a "safe" seasoning restaurant. I would visit Flavors of India again. There was plenty of food, the buffet had a lot of variety, and the service was good!

ubPAW2-B4_qb7xQzR82Qdg.text: I have had excellent luck with this place by always following the same formula.  Order mid-week, get the Chicken Tikka Masala and the Lamb Kwarma, order both at least medium, preferably spicy.  Ask for an extra side of rice, I have always gotten it at no extra charge and the portion of entree does require more rice.  Always order Garlic Naan, probably two orders.  This method will easily feed six people, or yourself for a couple days. I can't comment on the complaints expressed by others, as I have never tried Flavors of India their way. My way, I have always been on the verge of food romance pants explosion.

6afSrWXQAjiKM8BLcof5pA.text: I'm not sure what's going on with Flavors of India.  The last few times we went there, it was mostly empty and it just didn't feel good to eat there.  The food was okay but the experience was not enjoyable. Too bad...we used to enjoy it.  But based on my most recent experiences, I just can't recommend it anymore. :(

v2o4s017virAF8TsvkyNLw.text: I mostly do take out. I love the food and the service. I have tried a lot of Indian restaurants but their Samosa, Garlic Naan and Chicken Tikka Masala are great.  Enjoy!!!

3jLzrvt68M0SQwxTIRvG3g.text: When I lived in Phoenix this was the favorite destination for Buffet of anyplace in town. Always economical and delicious. Reasonably good service and air conditioned. The dining room can be quiet and intimate when the place isn't in buffet mode and is reasonable for a date.

t1dv1Io7RDwj0zxzhn5xMw.text: This restaurant is wonderful.  We have always ordered takeout although the restaurant looks very clean inside.  We don't do a lot of in restaurant dining.  The food is excellent and the family run staff is friendly, courteous and in all ways a pleasure to deal with.  I would suggest this restaurant to anyone.  The Biltmore area has some great lower key dining spots we want to point out to locals and travelers alike.  This is definitely worth a drive South of Camelback.

2221tdzN3L6PgvlAFOhNdQ.text: They've changed their chicken tikka masala recipe at least twice since my original review, and each time I've liked it less. The sauce used to be creamy. Now it looks like there's no cream in it, and it separates easily so the fat floats on the top. I'll have to find another restaurant to sate my chicken tikka cravings.

zKdArNs5-26HZZyB_NMDIQ.text: I have to start out this review by saying I never had Indian food before I ate here, so I didn't feel I could give it a fair review until I tried a few others around town first.  Well, now that I have, I have to say that "Flavors Of India" is the best Indian Food in Phoenix, bar none!  First off, when you walk into an ethnic food restaurant, and the place is filled with people of the same ethnicity, and the place is really quiet because everyone is busy enjoying their food, you know it's a good place to eat.    Is it a bad thing when the host/manager recognizes you when you walk in... and remembers your order?  You'd think we eat there a lot or something.  I've found my favorite dish is the Chicken Tikka Masala, medium spicy and if you like shrimp, the Shrimp Tikka Masala is just as yummy!  We usually order a side of the Paneer Kulcha (unleavened bread stuffed with Indian style cheese), which is wonderful to sop up the extra yummy sauce after you are finished.  Portion sizes don't appear to be too large, but we always have leftovers.  And it's always better the second day too!  The service is top notch, the food is excellent, and the best part of the dining experience is the Bollywood music videos playing on the flat screen!  Dinner and Entertainment all in one!  FTW!!!  I can't wait to go back!

nlO8c2LdyccpSCmtV9PUkA.text: Just searched on yelp and went there with friends. The food was really nice. Liked the chicken makhani that I ordered, my friend ordered paneer masala and it was yummy ! They charge you $0.99 per bowl of rice, but definitely worth it , it had a great taste !! Overall very satisfied with the food, the service could have been better due to which I am going for 4/5

rlwt9sDM2fnA0cbpJ7ZEMw.text: i like the quality of food here and icome here every 1-2 weeks. My favorite dish is chicken Makhani. chicken Masala and some of the lamb dishes are also worth trying. Good atmosphere and kind owners. downside is that it takes about 20-25 min for food to be served. prices are somewhat high.  did not like their buffet because there is no variety of food.

cRglqlmnvYy4VzKmXgfzKA.text: I try to judge a place by how good it is at what IT does and what they do they do well here. In terms of quick and affordable buffet Indian eateries they seem to have it down.   I work in the area and often need a break from the Biltmore and Esplanade fare. When I head over here I tell the guys in the office and I always have a couple jump to go with me. The guests' first reaction is the same every time; we pull into the strip mall and skeptically get out eyeing the place which is unassuming on the outside to say the least. We open the door and walk in and you get the inevitable, "Wow it smells good in here". You are shown your table and asked for your drink order and then asked to help your self. You will find 8-10 entree dishes + salads, chutney and desert waiting for you that has all been consistently fresh hot, well prepared and thankfully light on the heavy cream that all Indian places pour into every dish to make the, um... crackers eat exotic foods. They bring fresh Naan bread (included) to your table and have a full menu available as well.   The place is owner run and they are polite and attentive. Indian movie dance scenes run the background on a TV set a volume that does not interfere with your conversation and you can get in and out quick between meetings if you need to. Your guests who picked carefully on their first trip return to the table with a second, full, plate and eat until they complain they ate too much because it was so good. Lunch for 2 with iced-tea is about $22 - quite deal as well.

VAB0k78PDlUAj_8_GJ0fcQ.text: Unlike other reviewers, I didn't like the buffet, though my friends from work think it's a good value. However, I've been going for dinner to Flavors of India for nearly three years now, and have ALWAYS liked the food. FOI is my first choice for Indian cuisine in Phoenix, out of the four other Indian restaurants in the valley I've tried.   Yes, FOI is in a strip mall, but once inside, the ambiance is pleasant. It seems quite clean, I never got sick from anything I ate there (that's saying a lot, as I admit to being a fussy eater), and the waitstaff is helpful. Bollywood videos on the large flat-screen wall display in the corner are an unusual feature, but the volume is low or completely muted, so you can watch or choose not to, it isn't distracting.   (Here's a footnote about that: I ate at FOI on the night of the presidential primary election. My dining companion noticed that most of the waitstaff was gathered around the TV in the bar, watching electoral results, so he asked our waiter if we could watch too. After getting the enthusiastic okay from the two other occupied tables, it was quite late in the evening, silent Bollywood was replaced by live news coverage with volume turned on).  Regarding the food: I love their mattar paneer (cooked peas in a tasty curried gravy, with small cubes of homemade mild-tasting cheese).  My super-spicy friend gets the lamb vindaloo (super-spiced as he requests).  Tandoori shrimp, chicken and tikka masala are good though a bit pricier, the samosa appetizer (lightly battered and deep-fried cut vegetables) is fresh, warm and crunchy. Regular and garlic nan bread are everything they should be, biryani rice is overpriced (I'd stick with basmati rice as a side dish), and sweet lassi (a well-chilled dairy drink, similar in taste and consistency to a vanilla yogurt smoothy) is a nice treat. My spicy friend says his gin-and-tonic was weak, and they don't have ingredients to make a Bloody Mary, but hey, FOI is an Indian restaurant, so I can't fault them too much for that!   Other pluses: open a bit later than many Phoenix restaurants (seating ends at 9:30 pm); very fast with takeout orders; there's lots of parking; the 16 North bus stop is nearby; silverware, glasses, white cotton tablecloths and napkins are always spotlessly clean.

zWtC6oJoElY7YBeJYZ4F0Q.text: Time has not been kind to Flavors of India.  I just went back for dinner after a couple of years of inadvertently overlooking this place.  It appears that the management has changed and FOI is not better for it.  Perhaps the lunch buffet is still a good deal for the quality and quantity of the food they serve.  For dinner, it's offensive to charge $.99 for a side of rice to go with an order of Chicken Tikka Masala.  It's not an issue of the cost, but the principle of the matter.  Obviously, I'm going to order the rice.  Just up the price of all the dishes by a buck and throw us a bone with "free" rice.  And nearly $3 for a bowl of soupy Raita?  They need to change the name of this place to Nickel and Dime.         Farewell, Flavors of India, farewell!

SlsWQ7gmQNZ05pxBFQF-7g.text: This place had a hard time keeping up with the modest lunch crowd when I was there.   There were 3 buffet items that were totally out.  Not good since there were only a limited number of items to begin with.  I thought the taste was off, not my type of Indian food. No spice and no heat. Blah.  Come on, it''s a buffet and it's lunch.  Nobody has time to wait around for a piece of tandoori chicken.  Buh bye.

TtXIWAFRJSLiYzFK_9F46g.text: When I lived in the area, I would come by here for dinner, and occasionally lunch.  The buffet at lunch is ok.  Nothing stands out and grabs you and says "THIS IS THE BEST THING I HAVE EVER TASTED", but by far none of it is bland.  It is a buffet so my bar is not incredibly high.  For dinner, I have never been disapointed.  The curry is spicy, the masala is sweet and delicious.  My only True complaint about the place is the decor and the music.  I have come in on a few occassions and the place looks dirty, or the Bollywood Best is cranked up to the point of annoying.

jZrGQJeOaP96LdxelustrA.text: I live in the downtown Phoenix area, love Indian food, and have NEVER gone to this restaurant for dinner. I've been there billions of times for lunch. That should tell you everything I think about this place.  The lunch buffet is decent. It doesn't vary much so I know exactly what I'm getting every time I go. Since it's the only Indian place downtown, if I'm craving Indian, this is it. It's standard Indian. Nothing terrible, nothing spectacular.   For the best Indian eats in Phoenix you need to try Jewel of the Crown (a Scottsdale oldie), and the brand new Tandoori Times (also in Scottsdale).

FlIQqzj0xodmO88qVz6AAg.text: Yay! I'm a fan. Not an original comment, but it describes my sentiments. I think the place is pretty authentic -- without leaving with a smell of curry.   I love the Tikka Kabab Kandhari (boneless chicken comes out a-la-fajitas-style - sizzling with onions) and I order Nan and a side of the yogurt cucumber sauce. Then I make myself Nan tacos. (I hope I'm not making anyone cringe - but it's great and there's no food better than one you can eat with your hands!)   The location is odd, but I guess, after 3 years of being out here, I'm getting use to restaurants being in strip malls. The price of the food is reasonable - especially for dinner.   I took one of our Australian friends, who had recently moved to the States from London. He loved the food, and was thoroughly engage in a conversation with our waiter about cricket. (I kinda zoned out and watched the Bollywood music videos until they finished.)   Great place. Try it!

Iyrp5ts9ByTmEG24vFDXSw.text: I love the ambiance and think its cool that there is a bar there too.  The owner is very gracious and accomodating.  The food was very fresh and I like spicy...which is how they made the food.  I like the Bollywood videos and the ornaments around the room.  Very comfortable and good food!

ZAJ8YwFTMJu_79kIm5tTzQ.text: This restaurant is good and close, which is why we frequent it. Not the best Indian I have ever had, but still damn good. The decor is pretty standard, they have a full bar and a couple of TVs, one in the dining area playing Indian music videos which are always fun to watch. The staff is very friendly and attentive. The menu is pretty traditional, as far as Indian goes, Naans, Jasmine rice and Vindaloo, Tandoori, Masala, etc., with plenty for vegetarians and carnivores. Dinner is always good and the lunch buffet is not bad, either. The prices are reasonable and there is never a wait. As many times as I have been here I have never had a bad experience. Give it a try and see what you think.

eHa-qGVJK_AG5E1zqn5Eqw.text: This is my new favorite Indian restaurant.  Anywhere.  I had the lunch buffet, which was delicious, and after that I have mostly ordered Palak Paneer with naan and rice.  Their's is fantastic!  So delicious!  I love this place because it tastes so good, and because it is close to home, but the reason this place stands out among its peers is the service.  This place has really, really good service by any standard.  Waters get refilled promptly, waiters are helpful.  Orders are accurate and the staff is really friendly.    Yay!

ZjMOjAUR2ns7R-5OcgaDIg.text: Been into Indian food lately, a friend suggested this place..i was skeptical because its hard to find good indian food places..however once i tasted the food i was delighted, i have finally found my favorite indian restaurant in Phoenix. The food is very flavorful & rich..

8PP998RUR6Xo8hp2bVwoWg.text: What can I say? I've been coming here for years for a reason... The food is fabulous. Lunch time buffet for $10 all you can eat. The best tandoori and mango losi you will ever have. The atmosphere is perfect. Indian TV is soooo cool. ;)  I'll be coming back again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rRW_KMpSXFSymAwydPrwXA.text: Excellent food...nice and spicy (when requested)! We have gone twice and being Indian...I can recommend this place as a good source for a buffet and selection of food. The malai kofta is AMAZING!!!

eB0Fecmv6FcHn-qphGIziQ.text: The buffet is wonderful.  A wide assortment of Indian food at about $10.00 per person.  The chicken dishes are simply terrific.  They also provide bread on the table and a fountain drink for $1.00.  The decor is inviting and the staff are nice.  I recommend.

GUgQ16XQ8pXFBMXO37BfyA.text: At first glance, I almost turned around and got back into my car. It was in a dark stripmall, everything in that stripmall was closed, etc. The husband and I walked in to an almost empty restaurant, again I almost ran. I'm so glad I didn't. To put it simply...I adored this place! The service was great (not overly attentive but didn't ignore us), the decour was great and more importantly the food was great! I had the lamb Marsala (mild) and found it delicious. My husband enjoyed his meal too. This place is definately on our list of places to go.

pLJaHGTthda1LZ0oR7c29Q.text: We are visiting from NY for the week and found this restaurant because it is close to our hotel. It was fantastic. The service was friendly and efficient, the menu is extensive, the food was fantastic and the portions were large. We had a great experience and I would highly recommend this place.

EgeSCrEAwGiDJt6XtwhacQ.text: I've gone for the delicious buffet many times, but a friend ordered Malai Kofta off the menu and told me I had to try it. It was AMAZING! A delicious creamy gravy that's both sweet and savory with vegetable/potato dumplings. Dipping garlic naan into the gravy is exquisite! I would put that gravy on anything. Besides that, the staff is friendly and genuine.

UQrnSiNRnuPLpvTN1snzKQ.text: I ordered delivery at the recommendation of a friend. I was not disappointed. I've never had Indian food so I was a little nervous. I had the Butter Chicken and it was amazing. Can't wait to dine in one day.

3KzIAgvBS6_FMWoEJkr-yw.text: Still trying to find my Indian place in Phoenix! Very hard not to compare every place to my favorite back in Ohio. This place was the best I've tried here so far. Got paneer masala for takeout, my partner got the chicken tikka masala, and we got the garlic naan. The flavors were definitely on point and even tasted good cold this morning. It was only 99 cents for a generous portion, but still thought it was a little weird rice wasn't included. I will definitely try this place again.

3x7ekM-9SZhzfem0X5m5rw.text: Best Indian food I've had since I've been to Phoenix. Very high quality. The chicken samosas were amazing. Every time I want to order from there for lunch, I realize they're closed. Will probably order from here today. This is good.

GzECV3gilEAkWfWTxL6crQ.text: The food here is fantastic! We were nervous cause we have never been to an Indian food restaurant but it was so delicious and the service was superb.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fantastic!

tM_baZ5jnSjdOG5yvPpFOg.text: We LOVE FOI (as we call it). Just kidding. We just call it Flavors of India. But we do really love it. Their Chicken Tikka Masala and Chicken Curry are fantastic! You may want to request medium heat because it can clear your sinuses. Here's the perfect meal: chicken curry, an order of rice pulao, an order of garlic naan and maybe some veggie pakoras if you need a little appetizer action! MAGIC!

h9-21RqoCQlNCLJ3_S0GLA.text: Amazing Indian food, the vegetarian entrees and naans were prepared really well and great service! Would definitely visit again next time I'm in Phoenix.

Jpdkk-MqCRIrLzalJb10YA.text: I love Indian food. So good..  I ordered chicken tiki masala the spiciest they had. Not spicy at all. Not even mild. I had to add my own tapatio. (Sad) it has good flavor just a bit too creamy? Just wasn't feeling it but it was ok...

rw4TNRWioVuk8Qp4tj6Nhw.text: Very rude lead person. My daughter picked up order only to find it was wrong. I called to state this and she said she repeated your order to you . I said well I guess perhaps I didn't understand her accent but am assuming she wrote down what I said. There was to be a chicken dish and a shrimp dish. I then asked why there was no rice with the chicken tikki masala. She said that is extra. Then why would you not mention that since who eats that with out rice!? She would not budge or offer anything- just kept saying I was in the wrong so I just hung up on her and had a sandwich. no customer service skills at all

NYyZTJlDhBJyt2AlexAIaQ.text: We used to absolutely adore this place.  Came here for over 10 years.  Spoke frequently to the wife, daughter and husband and had friends in common at another Indian establishment.  We had a bad experience with our food around Thanksgiving 2017.  The chicken makhani caused both of us to have stomach issues throughout the weekend.  Since I thought we had a good rapport, I called the restaurant and left 2 messages for someone to call us back.  They never called.  All could have been forgiven if they had returned a call.  We just wanted to make them aware for future customers that the dish was no good but we were ignored.  Since this has occurred, we have not been back to the restaurant which is very unfortunate.  We brought a lot of friends and family there but due to the treatment we received, we won't go back.

SvbSPh_wqdXXJynRmS6wrg.text: Good food! Good Indian cuisine and Good selection of Indian dishes! It's worth checking it out.

VS5MgT5kt6O0w0aKaRho2w.text: This place is wonderful! The food is incredible and the service is great. Everyone there is so warm and kind. I am a big fan of Indian food and I was very impressed by theirs! I highly recommend the korma.

ytvBnIHdtbd6Syed83k6Bw.text: Delicious. I have never eaten in the restaurant and only ordered their food to go. I LOVE Indian food. Did I mention, while I am writing this review, I already placed to go order and will be picking it up shortly. :-)  When I first tried Flavors of India food, I ordered to go and had Chicken Tikka Masala, Basmati rice and Vegetable Samosas.  The chicken was superbly tender, masala was delicious and spicy enough, just how I ordered. Rice was cooked perfectly and Samosas are crispy on the outside and soft inside, perfect!   Excellent service! They make you feel welcomed. I picked up food from this place several time and always had great experience. It is bit dangerous that they are walking distance from my place as I can't never get enough of Indian food :-)   I can't wait to make it into the restaurant for dining in experience and also want to try their buffet one of these days.   Until then, I highly recommend this place! ~Namaste~

PuffodZt43WYTI7ufbQIMw.text: I love this restaurant. You are always greeted with a smile and it only takes a few visits for them to remember you. The food is always delicious and there's a good selection of vegetarian dishes. I've only been here for the lunch buffet. They do a great job of making sure all the dishes are full and fresh. I will continue to come here whenever the Indian food cravings hit.

PVW348hdmwPTf3-i9x7pFA.text: First customer and last time customer! Order was for pickup and was incomplete. When speaking to the restaurant they said it's wasn't their fault that it was the delivery company fault. But the delivery company doesn't make the order! They still wanted to argue about and offered NOTHING to correct THEIR mistake!

whusTnry43chO4r32m72kA.text: Great place! Came for the lunch buffet and they are so polite and nice. Good is amazing and freshgreat selection

y76LUOsTxSJHFNVCbGI-gA.text: Love to come here for the lunch buffet when I'm in the area. Great Chicken Marsala and Naan. Service is great to.

1zyZlkLby_p8L5Spe4HcHQ.text: I hadn't been here for many years!!!! Glad I came back. Great Punjabi food!!!! Very clean, fresh and reasonable. The staff is courteous, polite and prompt...

D78GIA5intfXp12ghRUz8Q.text: Awesome food and the entire staff is amazing. The restaurant is beautiful and very colorful. I got the chicken tiki masala with rice and garlic naan and everything was delicious, perfectly spicy. The owners walk around and help out and speak with each of the guests. They make the experience very nice and personal.

JIxJ66ZIAC9tAssEGsAQtQ.text: We have been going to flavors of India for about fifteen years.  It almost always is a very pleasant experience.  We went during July of 2016 for a family celebration dinner. The rest of the family had chicken dishes and they said they were delicious.  Even my incredibly picky and spice phobic son found their chicken Tikka Masala was good. Not chicken mcnuggets but good.  My daughter really loved the Mango chicken.  They made up a special vegan jalfrezi for me and my wife had the chicken vindaloo.    Don't be afraid of it being too spicy.  They wouldn't have been in business this long if they didn't know how to cater to all pallets.  I actually thought mine was mild and they had to bring chili chutney.   The atmosphere is pleasant and the prices are fair.  A family dinner for four with tip and no alcohol but with lots of happy tummies was under only $80 as of this writing.  That is absolutely everything including the tip.

3POWKKa3vCO6uZ5ub1M4Pg.text: Yummy ,tasty, affordable and fun!!! First time here and got the buffet it was awesome, there is so much to try , lamb , chicken, really good , will be back!!!

7zkG1O5fSmZcCY5yi9q38Q.text: Delicious lamb curry, chicken naan, mango yogurt and freshly prepared samosa. Not sure why it is getting negative press; very pleasant Saturday night meal.

TGdzjRiKwHgdMx7ThioRyQ.text: I Love Indian cuisine and this place was great!  Good buffet for lunch and friendly service.    I'm a lover of butter chicken and I literally ate like Homer Simpson at a buffet lol ( shows you my age) this and the mango dessert I couldn't get enough of!  They never ran out of food and quickly filled the trays in a timely manner.  This place is worth the drive and you will leave happy.  I did!!!  The buffet is always good to get a sample of different items.  It's also great for vegetarians!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Naan and butter chicken.. Yummy in my Mutha f*****n tummy

5fvOrp1J14tB2ZIcx9n9zQ.text: Top 10 (maybe even top 5) best meals I've had in Phoenix. If I'm being honest, the generic name kept me away from this place for years, but I am thrilled I finally decided to check it out. We had the chicken tikka masala, palak paneer, samosas, naan, and garlic naan and every single bite was delicious. The staff gave us just the right amount of attention and allowed us to take our time as we enjoyed the delicious meal. Prices are what you'd expect for your portions, but flavors go beyond expectations! I highly recommend this place and will surely be adding it to my list of most frequently visited restaurants in the valley.

4kC02OR74Qx2VK_bQ6gomg.text: Great Indian food and great people. They have to be the nicest people in Phoenix! Try the vindaloo - if you can handle the spiciest ask for a 10.

9hp5IrDdoglCe4qh22HGpA.text: It was a nice restaurant. Coming from bay area what surprised me was extra money for salad, extra chatnis etc. Food was pretty good when i compare it to india delhi palace. What we ordered: Dal tadka: was pretty good Gobi Manchurian: was hopeless Paneer was tasty  All in all the food was good and i would recommend people going to Phoenix to have food at this place once.

rlJuIXBCp5eZVBFNt88IOw.text: The best Indian buffet lunch this side of Mumbai with a wide variety of flavorful options.  Make sure you accompany your delectable meal with a Mango Lassie.

GvDeRMGXy8sdbUqQuyeYYQ.text: My visit to Flavors of India was the first Indian buffet I've visited although I've been to other Indian restaurants-just not buffets.  The food was good.  The number of dishes was limited to about six including vegetarian and chicken.  I was disappointed that there was no meat except chicken .... no lamb or goat.  Service was non existent since it is a buffet.  There was a man who delivered water but not happily.  He also brought nan which he put at the farthest end of the table.  No further contact with him and that was fine with me.  The woman seemed to be the binding force that held the restaurant together. The building was older and in need of remodeling but the establishment did the best it could with indian motif draperies and statues. There was no price list with the price of the buffet.  I thought $11.00  was a bit on the steep side.  I only had water and I did like the fact that the man brought a small pitcher of water for the table.   When I got home I yelped Indian Buffets again and found that $8 to 9$ seemed to be the standard price. Won't make that my "go to" place until I check out other Indian restaurants and have a comparison.  Until then, I won't go back regardless of the number of reviews.

ssDV2M3Zj8ncdBCojpRIcQ.text: Very clean and warming atmosphere. The service was prompt, kind, and helpful - they all worked as a team to ensure customers were well taken care of and had everything needed to enjoy their experience.   The food was unbelievably delightful. We ordered the #55 Navratan Korma (veggies cooked in a creamy curry-like sauce). The #55 Korma with the rice was money - I would recommend it every single time. We also ordered the #53 Baigan Bharta (mashed roasted eggplant with onions, green peas, and tomatoes) and paired it perfectly to dip with the garlic Naan bread. Word of advice to diners - always get at least one garlic naan order per person - and yes, definitely go with the garlic.  Overall it was a fantastic experience and it's so conveniently located near the Camelback shopping areas. So next time you're in the area, certainly stop here for excellent service and phenomenal flavors. Looking forward to visiting this place again soon.

ecKsFLkGWSw_GX9uT3Vlrg.text: This place is a bit pricey for dinner. Chicken vindaloo, rice, and naan ran me $17. I ordered spicy, but it was closer to a spice level of medium. Portions were about what to be expected, maybe a touch small on the vindaloo. The chicken vindaloo was good but was nearly half potatoes, not what I am used to. Naan was warm, tasty and not undercooked or served cold like some other restaurants I have been too.  I would like to rate this place higher, but the price makes justifying that out of the question. It is standard Indian fair that is good, it just simply isn't great.

K3MHvC9IOchU3u4LyckE9w.text: Good food, good service, decent prices.  Do you need more?  They have a lunch buffet which ends up being about $13.00 per person after tax and tip, and it has very decent variety.  I tried everything--don't judge me-I suffered afterward, but it was worth it. The tandoori chicken, the onion pahkor, and the mango pudding were serious winners. YUM!

ftrQ8ka2hUXDBHWxjUSdOQ.text: I feel bad.  This place seems to be much better with vegetarian dishes than chicken (or bread) ones.  Chicken Tikka Masala: Very flavorful, good density, nice portion,  I would get again in a heartbeat...without the chicken, which was overcooked, tough and dry (even sitting in that lovely sauce).  I removed most of the chicken and gave it to the dog.  I should have gotten the Chana Masala...  Tandoori Chicken: Flavorful, well spiced sauce.  Overcooked.chicken (again...)  Dry and tough under the lovely sauce, bell peppers and onions.  Shameful...  Naan Bread: So I think those saying this place uses too much butter on the bread have got it wrong.  They are UNDERcooking the bread and the ingredients are possibly not balanced right!  It is doughy, internally damp and dense.  The undercooking makes it a bit gooey\chewy and not the flat, airy perfection that is should be.  Super disappointment as naan is always delish!  Samosas (non-meat): Delish!  Seriously, even my young daughters liked them - though they thought they were a tad spicy.  I would get again, no problem!  Mango Lassi: Average - I let the girls and my husband finish as I wasn't super impressed.  Ugh, and please keep it chilled!  Aloo, Chole & Paneer: So so good!  Well spiced, right thickness, evenly cooked, wonderful flavor and aroma.  Such a keeper!  OVERALL: Like I said, I think this place needs to learn how to cook chicken and bread.  Then they would be a solid 4.  As is, the more I think about what a travesty all that undercooked, too dense, limp naan bread was, the more I am thinking a 2 is still being kind...  Still looking for a go-to Indian food joint...

6gbqJ35i2ZdTlFszuXpfgw.text: I really never cared much for food of India until my friend invited me to go and eat at this wonderful place I tasted the food it was a high quality food for a very affordable price that food is out of this world the only Indian restaurant I really would go to most of the time or invite friends is flavors of India the best I highly recommend this wonderful restaurant you won't be disappointed I know I wasn't disappointed

H-UdN-RNpIV9sL4jQK_bLQ.text: This place is so good. Perfect portion to price ratio. Friendly service and relaxing environment.

_NuX5y-dGNe8YPGfHvCUPA.text: Yesterday was my first time trying Indian food (don't judge meeeee!) and I'm now HOOKED! Anyone who hasn't tried Indian food, or is curious and wants to sample - go here.   This review is based on the lunch buffet, which beats out Chinese buffets any day of the week. You have a selection of 9-10 choices, plus dessert. The neatest part is the variety of food switches every day, so you're never eating the same thing over and over. Yesterday's buffet consisted of chicken masala (chicken, spices, tomato sauce cooked), daal makhani (lentil soup), bhindi (bombbbb okra!), chicken curry... and a ton of other goodies (dessert was shahi kheer - basmati rice pudding with almond and pistachios).   My only complaint was the bread, as it felt like it was covered in oil. However, for $11.99 and all you can eat - I don't really care.  Side note: they play this channel on their TV that's an Indian version of MTV - so freaking entertaining.

q5g9vAw6uRB_DWzL7Oo_dw.text: We went for the lunch buffet. The food was tasty, but not spicy, and much of it was lukewarm. It was about 50-50 meat and vegetarian options.

AAxKhBM8eIIsgmFrlQk20A.text: Their food is very good but i give Service at about a  6 and that's basicaly because they do not listen to those that come to eat there.  I've asked and asked for some sort of hot spice to put on my food because I know what I like.  I'm constantly told " oh no we don't carry that here". Now just because of that, which is important to me, my wife and I only go there when the other two are closed. Sorry but I feel if I'm going to come to a place to eat and spend my money they should try to give good service.

P2A34bfsmwQFcML6xj28hg.text: I've been eating here for years over multiple owners.  The service has always been good, lunch buffets fantastic! When I worked in the area I stopped in once a week for lunch or dinner and always had a very fresh and flavorful meal.  Great place to stop for good Indian food.

KJ_dnHmCeBIiUIcXqF5ggQ.text: In the past, these guys have been hit or miss. The last few times however the food has been excellent. We always get grubhub delivery because we are too lazy to pick up or eat there and the food always arrives fresh and hot. The tandoori chicken was super moist and flavorful. The eggplant and samosas were outstanding and the naan freshly baked. Overall a definite  star!!

EB3srN0072DVcMfRpWPQcg.text: First time here today. The food is very good. I had never tried Indian cuisine, I enjoyed tasting everything. The overall environment is very family friendly. The smell of the sauces, cream, rice, whole-wheat flour (aa), and a variety of lentils, such as masoor (most often red lentils), tuer (pigeon peas), urad (black gram), and moong (mung beans). Just really goodx spicy but good.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A little taste of everything, vegan and non vegan options. Felt good after eating and did not feel heavy stomach.

G3Fvi4IFithBgXF5qoVYCQ.text: My favorite Indian restaurant in Phoenix!  Amazing food. All the breads are fantastic and I always recommend the chicken tikka masala.

AS8oMYlfBH4sTr_IXKP3zg.text: Stopped in here for their weekend lunch buffet.  The food was good but I like very spicy Indian food and this was not that.  It was however flavorful and they had a good variety of vegetarian and chicken dishes available.  If you like less spicy Indian food this place is worth a try.

kyun5g4i-3AoOMRt-aDdOw.text: Wow. We ordered foods at 5:20. It wasn't ready until 6:20. Why allow people to call I if you are going to make us wait so long! It probably would have been faster to go in and order and wait. Absolutely ridiculous. Not even an apology or any $ off.

p8DDHcBwInwTxK24pCwmAg.text: Best India food in the valley by far..... The Lamb Tikka Marsala is just to die for. It was gently sweet and robust..and the Lamb Curry is a hearty bowl of heat with little chewy islands of umami. I also highly recommend the garlic naan bread....

4du8c45AYj2YxEdj9g2jWg.text: Love them!  Whether it's take out or dining in.  It's amazing!  My first time trying to Flavors of India I ordered take out, a yelp recommendation   It was almost 9pm and I had a craving for either Caribbean food or Indian Food.  I Yelped Jerk chicken first, nothing in my area and opened during that time.  So I yelped Indian food.  Flavors of India came up .. with only 3.5 stars.  I wasn't intimidated by the 3.5 star review because I really had a craving so I gave it a try.  SO GLAD I DID!  I ordered chicken samomas, and chicken marsala to go.  The lady on the phone said it'll be about 20 mins.  I only live about 5 minutes away.  I left my house in 15 minutes.  Everything was ready, hot and waiting for me when I arrived.  The chicken samomas were so hot that I couldn't bite into them at all!  It was poppin hot!  No worries, that's such a good sign!  The minute I got home I opened the chicken marsala, put in on a plate and feel in love.  My eyes rolled in the back of my head as I chewed.  My heart smiled and my stomach was full after I finished my meal.  This was a Friday evening.  The portions sizes are huge.  I had plenty of leftovers for lunch Saturday for me AND enough to share with my boyfriend at the time.  He loved it!  The next weekend, the next Friday.  He said ... Let's go back to that India place you went to last year.  I said sure.  We dined in this time, shared chicken simosas and both of us ordered different chicken dishes.  I don't remember the name of either dishes but it wasn't chicken marsala this time, but it was served sizzling and saucy.  It's allll about the sauce ... and the bass   That was from a song I think! We also shared the Indian house beer.  It was light and paired so well with the chicken.  I highly recommended Flavors of India to everyone.

CvQ2hMvpEGWYGH3hPk_Xfw.text: Amazing casual dining experience!! Food was mouthwatering, service A+, we will be back!!

odO9Zs9JVX1zlgwi3uzNNg.text: Don't listen to the negative reviews. This place is great--my family has been coming here for several years and the family that owns it is great. Some of the best Indian food I've ever had. My go to is chicken vindaloo or biryani--both flavorful, succulent, delicious! My husband loves the tikka masala and jalfreezi. Samosas and garlic naan are great as an appetizer. Their food is always fresh and spice level is spot on. The place and location may not look hip and trendy but that doesn't matter. The food is so good, prices are decent, family and servers are friendly and helpful. Check it out!

hY4nVdVz9t7M7hNds-T1_g.text: This place doesn't look like much from the outside, but it's a very nice small business on the inside. It was quite busy for the lunch buffet, which was a good sign. As soon as you walk in, you are greeting with the delicious aroma of the food and spices. The staff is friendly, and you can tell they are passionate about their business. The food is amazing, and the buffet was very reasonably priced. Will definitely be a repeat customer!

FtSyncHUFlTeob2U2_j75Q.text: Haven't had root door buffet but service here is kinda lousy food is decent but will come out piping hot as if it just came out of a nuclear reactor and will take an hour to cool down. Suuuuper stingy with rice and sauces really bad service doesn't check up much with customers

fvVfGr8piGE0DUe4h7km6A.text: Well prepared, fresh food and excellent service. I loved it and will be back to Flavors of India the next time I am in Phoenix.

51S4lu2xy7NlA4AdYN-LuQ.text: Just such a lovely little buffet lunch with my sister and baby niece. They gave us a nice booth and cooed at the baby and the food was delicious and everyone was so gracious about us taking our sweet time to enjoy one another. thank you!

ljxMw6PInB85fZJXStv_Ig.text: The services sucks, but the food is sooo good! so i dont really care anymore lol as long as i get the food :)

Yc2t_dZE-gZdyvJyiRcUyA.text: It's a great place!amazing food especially Vegetarian dishes! I loved the Chilli Paneer and Veg Jalfrezi.. Very hospitable staff and owner  USF students get Disco t too! So Go Bulls

ST77_rCYEM_Ztc7yK-8HYw.text: Service was friendly and food was reasonably priced and delicious! I got the tandoori naan and paneer masala.

RR8OUWXZRACCkyK4Dt5whg.text: Went there two years ago near closing time but had a tasty memorable meal. Would like to go again. Decor is a bit dated but food is very authentic because we are very familiar with the "flavors of Indian" cuisine.

5cdX4rtfrR3ofixA6J_pgQ.text: Date night dinner was terrific. Staff was friendly and attentive. Samosa, Tikka Masala, and Peas Palou were sooo good. Really happy right now. Will be back soon.

UF48sOQtlzTNIpU-QYPW-g.text: We ordered lunch from Flavors of India today for our office. It was delicious! Everyone enjoyed very much and it is now on our list of best places to order from. The food had amazing flavors and tasted very  fresh.   I phoned in our order the day before because it was a large order and when I picked it up the next day it was ready for me and the order was perfect..and warm!   Great customer service, great food. Highly recommend!

1zcIGwpecw9sm7VQ3yqFpw.text: Food at the lunch buffet was tasty, would like more meat dishes though (mostly vegetarian options when I went). Fresh supply of naan delivered to the table was nice

KQrWfALS34hRbzxAeGUYFw.text: I've eaten Indian food everywhere. As an Englishman it's part of our cuisine DNA. This visit was spontaneous and rushed, as I'm working out here and still not sure of my surroundings. I'm totally impressed however, perfect vegetable samosas, delicious lamb tikka (medium-hot) and very tasty tandoori naan. Cannot find a fault. I thoroughly recommend this restaurant. I'm taking some of it for lunch tomorrow, and already looking forward to it.

A2CyuDrRlWHZLDul2yvKMw.text: Great Indian food here. It's been almost 6 years ago since I've eaten here. Their buffet food never disappoints. Even their gulab jamun (the little donut hole-like dessert) tasted fresh. Unlike the ones I've had before from other Indian restaurant in the valley that was cold and stale. Everything was great!

hTXZRn8YpwlEm_FZxD3u8Q.text: Went here for lunch and it wasn't the first time I've been here but I was still pleasantly surprised by the food which was amazing! The chicken makhani, which in most places means big chunks of tough chicken, was surprisingly tender and delicious. The vegetable pakoras were absolutely delicious, the best I've had in the valley. The mushrooms and eggplant dish were both very good. The mango pudding, although sounds plain, was absolutely delicious and tastes fresh. The chai tea actually tasted like chai tea and not like tea with milk, you can actually taste the spices in this one.  I was very pleased with my meal. The only downside I can say is that for a buffet it is a bit more pricey than other buffets, but this delicious food is definitely worth the extra expense. This place really does live up to its name Flavors of India. If you love Indian food you must eat here.

2VHzy8jXmKIlQ2nxnd08kw.text: Not very good, this was probably some of the worst indian food I've had.  (I've been pretty spoiled)  At one point there was something that was hard in my food and I cringed when I bit down.  I'm not sure what it was.  I'm used to very well flavored Indian food, and the curry was bland. The service was good, and it was inexpensive, but I think I'll try some other local places first before returning.

WpIwjaZxF_NRCh8lfjhx6g.text: really awesome Indian food. do the chicken rogan Josh. the spice level is often a bit of a mystery ranging from unbearable to pretty mild on the same dish on different days but its an adventure! the staff is always very friendly and welcoming. do it!

d1FzjPYAHXpAW5YLHAFdqQ.text: I have a few Indian food haunts and this is one of my favorites. I do like the Chicken Tikka Masala and also the Vindaloo. The garlic naan is GREAT! It's good to eat in or for take out as well. If it's take out they are really fast which is nice. Love it!

je65DtbgfP881RwUbNOJeA.text: Fresh and delicious - very happy to discover this place! We had the chicken tikka masala and aloo gobi. We ordered them mild and they still had a nice kick to it but not too spicy for us. The chicken was moist and nothing was greasy or heavy.

r8L5KOWw4DvGYmSckzln4A.text: Great dinner and reasonable prices. Server gave us lots of attention even though the place was packed. We've come here several times and also been happy. Glad we live close.

1AZ2Z8x_b-NoXz1JWzUcyg.text: They bring the heat when you ask for it:  score!  I love places that don't distrust me when I say that I want something hot.  I asked for hot for a reason, so give it to me.  Luckily, on my last few take-out orders, Flavors of India has trusted me.  We're both pretty happy to finally be in a trusting relationship.    I've only ever done take-out here and to be honest, it has always been the same dish- paneer tikka masala.  I love that they add chopped onions and cilantro to the masala mixture.  The rice is your standard Basmati.  My interactions with the employees have been efficient and friendly.  This is my current go-to for take-out Indian.

oWXUxTdZ9nfSrpXW0_PKqQ.text: Oh my gosh, I haven't tasted anything this delightful in years. Service was impeccable and friendly. This restaurant is a MUST VISIT!

QIns95r39O5DlvFjiBU3HA.text: Reading through the reviews, I have a feeling that this place has changed over the past several years.  I went in for lunch about three years ago and was very disappointed.  I went in again last week and had an excellent experience. The buffet is extensive and flavorable.  My only reservation is that the spice level is 1 or less, but the management seems to be eager to help with that issue or any others.  I will be returning with my wife for dinner on Friday or the weekend due to the excellent food quality, the attentive staff and the eager to please management.

1HYYiv7jYEBzh6LTDkAGNg.text: Pretty standard Indian. And by standard, I mean this is what you will find at almost every Indian restaurant in America. I am no Genuine Indian food expert, but your average USA Indian restaurant will have the same menu as every other one, no matter what city or state you're in.   That being said, if that's what you're in the mood for, then FOI will fit the bill. It's in a very sad-looking strip mall, and the management of the restaurant must be very anxious about all of the empty storefronts around them. But the interior of the restaurant is spacious and comfortable, and when I walked in to pick up our takeout order, I was immediatelly greeted by a very friendly host.   The food was good, as far as overly-oily typical Indian fare goes. We ordered the Tandoori chicken, Tandoori fish, naan, and a cauliflower and potato dish. All were very tasty and served with basmati rice.   I have two criticisms of the food: 1)the onions in the tandoori dishes were raw. Perhaps if we had eaten there, they would have been served in a cast-iron skillet, which would have improved matters. I'll withhold final judgment until we try it again. The meats were all very good, though.  2)OILY. Oh my goodness, there must have been equal parts oil and vegetables in the cauliflower dish. I wonder if Indian restaurants are under the impression that Americans really do want their food swimming in oil and that's why they make it that way, or if True Indian food, in India, is also as oily as what you'll find at restaurants here? I don't have the answer.   **I will put in a plug here for Bombay Spice, at Tatum and Shea, which is Indian food made healthfully, without nearly as much oil or cream as most restaurants. I wish I could count on that everywhere. **  So, it was a solid 3-star experience, given that it met my expectations of very oily, very tasty average Indian food. It would definitely earn another star or two if someone in the kitchen made an effort to cook with health in mind. It's really not hard.

7NoqoG7H1JlRynkBlAZxFQ.text: Not happy with this restaurant at all. Placed an order for take-out, and every single dish had an issue. We ordered paneer & potato masalas and palak aloo. Unfortunately, the best part of our meal was the plain basmati rice. Our masalas were made with the most disgusting over-microwaved potatoes I have ever consumed. The sauce was pretty good, but a little too sweet and since the potatoes were rubbery, tough and dark, it made it difficult to eat. The palak was even worse. We had to keep removing some ingredient that was woody and fibrous from the sauce. It was under salted, extremely bitter and tasted more like ginger and cream rather than spinach. I love ginger, but this was so overwhelmingly bad. For some odd reason, the potatoes in our palak were not microwaved like the masala was. I know that the paneer & potato masala is not on their menu, but I'd much rather them say that they cannot make it rather than give me something so awful. I'd expect so much better after paying $60 bucks. Sucks since this is the closest Indian restaurant by far. I'll just have to drive the distance next time. Boo.

HlmR9JfjRNj9SPZB6Af58g.text: Came back to Flavors of India on Friday night for an early dinner.    Hey wait staff:  stop watching TV at the bar and pay attention to your customers when they 1) want to place an order 2) need more water 3) need a to-go box 4) want their check so they can get outta there!    Jeez!

I3RfG9R3B8RLo2thCjoZZA.text: I went there today for the first time for the lunch buffet. It was good and the service was great, very attentive. Will be back for the regular menu.

oN3OoK_ylPgUtABVywj4Kw.text: best lunch buffet in town. only $10. my favorite place.

rQo2oqX1C1QGc1J-xnrIHQ.text: So on the spur of the moment, I decided to stop into Flavors of India for lunch today as I was driving by... I love Indian food. And with just a couple of exceptions, haven't found much of it in the Phoenix area that I would categorize as great tasting. Unfortunately, this place fell more into the norm of Phoenix Indian food than not.  I wasn't that it tasted bad... It just wasn't particularly awesome or memorable. Excluding the couple of saving graces of the aloo tiki (fried potato & Indian cheese fritters) & kheer (rice pudding), the food was just meh. And with a $10 price tag for the lunch buffet, I think that there are definitely better places for me to spend my lunchtime.
