sx7cEKwYZMbIOsZOaUsgUQ.text: I used to be scared...I used to be petrified.  I was never one to branch out with my variety of cuisine, which meant that I never had Indian food before...until a couple of months ago when I was invited to a dinner party. And at Flavors of India...my Indian Food cherry was broken.  I decided to review this place now...since I have experienced other restaurants since.  I tend to always come back to this location.  The place seems very clean, I love the Bollywood videos that they play, and I love the service.  And I think that they have the best buffet!    Now, I am really bad at names of the food that I order there (which is why I end up at the buffet...I may not know the names, but I know what I like looks like)  See me there at lunch real soon :)

O6KKAM1_t-0KT5Xpd6tySQ.text: Great service and very good food.  We ordered the Lamb Curry, Aloo Mutter, Chicken Tikka Masala and Garlic Naan.  Everything was/spiced/seasoned to order just as we requested.  The aroma of fresh garlic from the naan was outstanding.  Great portions and reasonable prices.  Need extra rice and they did not hesitate and did not charge.  Will definitely be back for the lunch buffet.

0WF9EOkP46UtCNfxSjg2AA.text: What a great find.. I've been searching for years for a place like this.. sketchy from the outside but worth the wait and that you will do. Ordered chicken tikka marsala. (6 on spice scale, could have gone to an 8) and the lamb vindaloo (also a 6, more fairly spiced) with the garlic naan... oh la la, that hit the spot.. the restaurant is dim and loud from nearby tables but cute and comfy..we will be back and I'm not sure I would even waiver from my original selection it was that delicious... feel safe with this selection on flavor and atmosphere but step out of the box for more flavor with the spices.....

K1t5FczWe2-NQOAwAWBeaQ.text: OK so maybe I'm just a simple Scandanavian man, with an easily pleasable palette. But judging by other yelp reviews, my first FOI experience stands alone. I get a kick out of most Thai/Indian/Asian strip mall restaurants. The decor is pretty tacky. So, I tend to get my chow to go. I had the friendliest, most helpful lady guide me through the menu. We picked out a vindaloo, a tandoori, 2 orders of naan, some veggie fritters and a tikka masala.  Vindaloo 2 stars Tandoori 3 stars Masala 5 stars Fritters 0 stars ughhh  Naan 5 stars King Fisher Beer 10 stars...can I do that? Service 5 stars False ceiling with stains 1 star To go boxes and packaging on full display behind bar 1 star Decor...Bollywood meets flea market meets storage room Well, as they say in India, um, hmmm...I don't really know what they say in India. So, I settle for see you later yelpers!

3ZRRUE93nDZUKX1GtFgsuQ.text: So my sister used to go here with her friends and then suddenly stopped, claiming that there was a cockroach in her food, so naturally I avoid this place... until I get taken here to lunch with some friends...  I'm open-minded, okay? I'm going to try it out and not say anything to my friends about my sister's experience... so here is my take...  We order appetizers, four dishes, lots of food basically. I tried all of it and wasn't impressed. Lack of flavor. Service was eh.   So, highlight of the visit -- the restroom. What do I find? Baby roach, still struggling for life. Disgusting. If there are baby cockroaches in this place, that means they are breeding! More to come! I don't like to pay to eat at dirty places.   Though, they had an extensive vegetarian menu.   But the people here, the customers I mean, eh. They kinda have an attitude of, 'omg, ethnic food.' Pft. I got the vibe it was like a special occasion for them to eat at this dump... I don't know how to describe it, maybe I'm being a jerk but that's what I picked up on...  Why pay a decent amount of money for mediocre (at best) food?

RJG88-zkPvzsvGZP8eL3zg.text: This was the worst experience ever in a restaurant!  First, the service was lackadaisical at best.  It was very slow to have our order taken, and it took almost 40 minutes from the time we ordered to get our food. The food itself was tasty enough, once it finally arrived.  However, the worst part about this meal was the COCKROACH that we discovered on the wall over our table.  Immediately, my friend and I began to point at it and talk loudly. We tried to get the attention of waitstaff for several minutes.  Finally, the cockroach fell onto our table. That was it. We leapt out of the booth and exclaimed "COCKROACH!" Is this the worst part of the visit?  NO.  Waitstaff then came over, pulled back the table, squashed the cockroach, and then gestured for us to resume our meal and said "Cockroach gone."   At least the manager comped the meal.  But,  if there is one cockroach allowed to crawl around the dining room TABLES, I can only imagine what the kitchen might look like. I definitely can't imagine going back!

OUZVVaT8_hYj1W4YZpu6xw.text: Flavors is easily my favorite Indian restaurant in the Valley. With friendly wait staff, good prices and fantastic food you can't go wrong. Don't be fooled by it's humble exterior; it's the food you're there to enjoy. I prefer to skip the buffet as I like my food XXXX-Indian-hot, but I have never been disappointed at dinner. In fact, the staff recognize me and my daughter and often ask if we'll have our regular, even if it's been months since our last visit.  My absolute favorite is the lamb vindaloo while my husband has chicken korma and my daughter goes for the chicken tikka masala and a mango lassi. Don't forget the rice pudding (kheer) for dessert. You won't be disappointed!!!

Sk1T89J48mJqCBbT_USmhQ.text: Quality has really gone down the past few years. I've been coming here since the day they opened up in 2003. Please bring back the original cook!!

BqmmmpRIjy5IotkxCi_fXw.text: Perfect authentic food. Generous portions. Relaxing atmosphere. Just beautiful! Great  service. I want to try everything on the menu. Just go!

Km26sdqOPWKIj1iIWpdXOw.text: Quite the ironic name for this restaurant.  I think their name should start the term "Americanized" or "subdued." The dishes on the lunch buffet were standard but they lacked the vigor that good Indian food has.   I have gone here a few times for lunch with co workers, the vegetarian selection is decent. The fried items can be a bit soggy from sitting out too long.  The lunch buffet now is topping $10 which is pretty steep of a mediocre lunch. I feel like there should be a discount at places like this for vegetarians. The Naan, and water is brought tot you by a server so you may feel the need to tip on top of the buffet price.   There is the stereotypical bollywood music videos playing on the TV, with their psychedelic colors and lavish garb. Many of the serving trays make extensive use of aluminium foil which I doubt meets health code.

JMB5LakGHJc2KghG1dRQxw.text: Service and Food is R&R!  I make this short and sweet. Lets find the real places in Phoenix and lets support the authentic, creative, and traditional restaurants.   True, it feels a little awkward because of the metaphysical transportation from USA to India. After 10min its like you are in India. Cliche, but lets be honest, if you have have been there its kinda the truth.   Service: Very approachable, knowledgeable and sincere. The table next to us for some odd reason didnt like the food, she said it was "too different." Uh? Ok..its Indian food! Its meant to be different. Nonetheless, the ?manager? insisted on offering dessert. The patrons denied his generous offer multiply times. GREAT SERVICE!! (Our service was *5stars*)  Food: Sadly, I don't know what I devoured because I arrived late and they just placed the food down as soon as I sat down. That being noted, what ever it was ...it was goood!!!!!  The chicken fell of the bone, the sauces were savory and spicy, and the rice was moist.  Well R&R (Recommend & Return)  R \_  NOte: Lock your doors, the Flavors is in a exasperated area.

em3k9ikoBiYzONwvwALr6Q.text: I miss this place!  We used to live around the corner from Flavors of India and went here at least a couple times a month.  Favorite dishes were Malai Kofta (sp?) and Palak Paneer. My husband loved their lamb dishes.  Their lunch buffet was just okay. Could have a better selection.  Service was always good. They are sooo nice. One time we ordered takeout and my husband who was sick at the time picked it up. The girl at the counter offered him a little baggie of spices to help with his ailment. How sweet and thoughtful!   When we eat in for dinner, we enjoy the Indian beer, and my husband REALLY enjoys the Bollywood music videos. Hmmm... could it be the completely gorgeous Indian women dancing around in saris?

I-G1WDn_vpvEVCSGxd67gQ.text: I have eaten here many times but I wasn't so impressed when I ate there for lunch the other day.  I guess the thing to remember about this place is to get there early.  If you don't, you will be waiting for food and nan.  My wife and I got there at 12:30 and every container was at the bottom or empty.  Asked the lady what was up and she said that everyone came in at once. Uhm, yeah, it is called a lunch rush.  Really pissed me off that she said that.  Waited for food and waited even longer for the nan.  Even though the service was really lacking this day, I will be back because the food is good.

YIk6q9ornH_ZEPm1cr0-xQ.text: The all-you-can-eat buffet is the best value in town! I just love the onion bhagis and potato pakoras. I believe there are always at least 2 chicken dishes and a tandoori chicken, the standout was the chicken keema aloo. I'm not a big fan of okra, but what they did with it and onions was very nice and subtle. They also had a squash dish that had nice, firm pieces of yellow squash in a wonderful sauce. This was also the first time I tried their dessert; it was gulab something: perfectly round balls of fried deliciousness in a hot, syrupy goodness. I could just have these for breakfast like pancakes! I didn't even get a chance to try their condiment bar. Trust me, you will leave very full.

pScJzXYMQ9T1QVD3rtAA8Q.text: My favorite Indian food in Phoenix. The menu is huge, the takeout is quick and always fresh.  The only Indian restaurant that does "Indian spicy" correctly.   It is a little quiet, and could do with more ambience, but the quality of the food more than makes up for it.

6AK3oBBeobMSJsUix7bKuQ.text: I had lunch here with Norm R. and Rand H. and after trying almost every indian buffet in the valley ,this one is got to be in the top 5.The buffet itself is layed out nicely and the food is always real good.This visit the onion cauliflower pakora was the big hit ,I could have ate just a big plate of those and been happy. The naan bread that was brought to are table was not the garlic type but was very good as well. The desserts here were great to they had mango pudding with fruit cocktail mixed in and rice pudding. (no monkey balls today)?Anyway it was a great lunch and 5 stars for them today.

BXTS3NQRMY6KNGf4ftpyRg.text: One evening I had a huge hankering for some Indian food. This restaurant was the closest, so I thought I would give it a try. Upon sitting down I noticed the interior of the restaurant definitely needed some work ... nothing really looked like it goes together. During my meal the employees were still working on cleaning up the lunch buffet. This seemed somewhat unprofessional. It also made me question their level of cleanliness. For my meal I ordered the garlic naan, chicken vindaloo, rice. The naan was somewhat thin/soggy then what I was expecting. The spice and flavor of the vindaloo was perfect, however there seemed to be a lot potatoes in it. Portions were what I expected. Excellent service. My bill came to $17 plus tip. Due to the ambiance and the average quality of the food I would have been content with a bill around $12. But with it coming closer to $20, I would have expected slightly larger portions or improved interiors or some stellar tasting naan. I would only give this place a second chance in order to try out their lunch buffet.

K3-0en49t-XIpr4oUFxN3g.text: My friend and I decided last minute that we wanted to go out to eat last night instead of staying in. Since it was a holiday we didn't want to try our luck at any of the restaurants nearby so we headed over to Flavors of India which is right down the street.   The place was a lot cuter and nicer inside than expected. We were seated right away at a large booth and the hostess gave me a rose for the holiday. They had a special of a large plate of grilled meats for $13.95 which our waiter said was enough for 2. So we split that and also ordered our usuals, Paneek Pakor and Naan. Our waiter also suggested Indian Beer, and I can't remember the name of it, but it was very good.   The food was all very, very good. The naan was much better than the other Indian restaurant we frequent. I can't wait to go back to try my favorites (butter chicken and tikka masala) although everything they had looked so, so good.   I was really impressed overall and I love supporting local businesses like this one.

mtRNliJ2ptclnEYfBj7_8Q.text: We went in for lunch today.  Parking lot was full and several people inside -- always a good sign that the food is good.  Was planning on doing the lunch buffet but found out they don't have Chicken Tikka Masala on buffet.   Sad panda.  So, we ordered Chicken Tikka Masala with some Garlic and Plain naan.  Service was very good.  The plain naan was excellent, while the garlic was a little too garlic for our taste.   The chicken tikka masala was decent, however it was more of a soupy texture instead of a paste that I'm used to.

Fl-I0X8XwNfKxRz1U1-rhQ.text: I finally had the opportunity to try this place. I went for dinner instead of the lunch buffet. My friend and I shared the appetizer platter, butter chicken, and lamb vindaloo. Everything was piping hot and fresh. Service was timed well even with a large group in the restaurant. Good portions. The appetizer platter and the lamb vindaloo were delicious. The butter chicken was too buttery for my liking. Maybe it is a different style/region of cooking. I am still on the hunt for a place that serves butter chicken that will taste almost like my friend's mother's butter chicken.

PxtyMVVOWTsfLrDbBZY0Sg.text: Amazing, Every time! I have been going to this restaurant for over 10 years and they have always impressed me.  Being a foody in the valley I find a lot of restaurants under par but my mouth is always happy here.

4pPYhCYMqxQxJvNea9M7zg.text: I had the lunch buffet today. All the food was hot and fresh.   Not a huge variety, but everything was up to scratch. The paneer spinach here is extra good. And I liked the meatballs too, kind of a sweet and sour taste. The dessert gulab juman balls were hot. They tasted fine, but I like them better cold or room temp. But all said, an enjoyable visit. Buffet costs $10 with ice water and free naan.

DiUjoXBbu60sauRMEvgk6A.text: Authentic North Indian tasting food. outstanding service. Cleanliness. Welcoming warm people. one of the best I have had

CrdBWZa8iTBpBDjDcZhJVg.text: Have went here for Dinner before, it was okay but not great. Went to lunch buffet and it's terrible.  Not spicy. The dishes taste nothing like they should.  If you must eat here, the Tandoori Chicken isn't bad.  However, if you really like Indian food, stick to Chutneys in Tempe, or the really good Indian Market with a buffet on 7th street near Thomas.

4_Actzd9UFGrQGCsKfsEnA.text: Found this gem right around the corner from the office. Wifey and I went for dinner after work. Was greeted instantly and what friendly folks! Like the seating of the booths, gives an intimate feel. I always judge Indian Cuisine by the lamb. So I order lamb Masala and my wife got the veg korma. Lamb was excellent you still could taste it slightly without being overpowered by the Tikka masala sauce. My wife absolutely loved the Veg Korma. Rice and nan was very good as well. Great portions and excellent prices. Will definitely check out the lunch buffet during the week!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States

p-tMsioNuUN5fWgSKq5wGg.text: The Best Indian food in Phoenix! Butter chicken and garlic naan. Nothing else is needed in life. For anyone that wants to try Indian food, try this place first you will not be disappointed. The service is amazing from the family that runs the restaurant. The parking is always available and the wait times are short! DEFINITELY try this place!

3JoFmuK56_vn3k_nqY7lEA.text: Service took a bit,  we sat down and got served water right away but to order we had to wait over 10 minutes and it wasn't busy! It was worth the wait! We had samoas and they were awesome.  I had chicken tikka masala and my husband had a lamb dish. Both were amazing and we both had enough to have lunch the next day. Our new favorite Indian resteraunt!

d7ZCtZcVLldl4E4Rhis9Fg.text: My dad and I are from out of town and we love to go to "exotic" restaurants when we go to Phoenix. We went to Flavors of India today and we were blown away with how incredible this place was! Friendly and helpful service, amazing food and lovely atmosphere. 10/10 would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mango pulp
Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TILYB3I9pnf0fGsU5s04FA.text: The family that owns this restaurant is so sweet and friendly! I went with a large group and it was perfect serving sizes to share with everyone!   We ordered the Samosas and loved them! They were perfectly cooked. Crunch on the outside was amazing!   We also got what they call their Mixed Grill. It had chicken and shrimp on it. It is cooked in their Clay oven and comes out on a sizzling plate. Loved it!   We also got their chicken tikka masala, 3 orders of it! I sat and drank up the rest of the left over sauce when the chicken was gone - it was that good!   If you haven't tried Indian food and want to explore it, this would be the perfect place. I'm a wimp when it comes to spicy things, so it was great that they offer different spice levels. The people with me can handle spice, so they were able to order to their taste buds. So we were all very satisfied with our dinner!

hooW0AwIcCONFHlKC-TaUg.text: BS - total waste . Food is average to good / but when I asked for onion , they say it's extra charge - come on who charges for onion . Crap .. not too good experience ..

ys8506XqGVQzqiSWBx8Hig.text: I LOVE Indian food! The flavors just give me those warm fuzzy feelings, and the food at Flavors of India was no exception. From the moment I sat down and saw the beautiful cloth on the table, I knew I was going to have a great meal.  This was also a FIRST for me. I ordered a mango lassi immediately (no waiting until the end of my meal). When it arrived at the table, it was the most beautiful color, not watered down with ice either, just creamy mango lassi. One slurp and one OMG, and my lassi was ripped from my clutches, making the rounds at the table with equal ohs and ahs from all who drank this elixir. I didn't let go of it after that; my fingers glued tightly onto the glass. Selfish? Yes.  The beauty of four of us is the luxury of family style or tasting four unique dishes. The aloo gobi masala had huge pieces of cauliflower. Yum. The lamb vindaloo was ordered at an 8/10. One of us likes it to burn; since he was picking up the tab, we all silently hoped it would arrive at the table with a little less firepower. Thankfully it wasn't an 8, more like a 4. The chicken jalfrezi was excellent with the onion chutney, and shrimp tiki masala had big shrimp! The plain naan and rice were the perfect additions to our meal to soak up the wonderful sauces.   A TV played an MTV-like station, but as my back was to this, I didn't really pay attention to it. There was too much going on at my table to be distracted. Service was excellent.   Great meal! What's next? Their lunch buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy!
Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. FINALLY, starting dinner with a mango lassi! Look at that color!

eNDbUpjXJTPMngdHb_etxg.text: I am still thinking of my entree a few weeks after I ordered it at Flavors of India. You know that means it's really good, or I'm really a fan of indian food and can get obsessive. I assure you it's the first option. We went in with family visiting from out of town and got a nice corner table. They greeted us right away. We had appetizers, 4 entrees and mango lassi. The only complaint was one of our party wasn't too crazy about the lamb dish. He says it was a bit too fatty for him. I don't eat meat so I can't vouch for any of that but I will tell you that the smells were so good and the flavors omg! The leftovers I devoured over a few days, tasted better the next day too! At first the Gobi manchurian was not exactly what I was craving (I had it at another place where it was spicier/sweeter). But....the day after I had the same dish as leftovers and it seemed like the flavors were even better than the day before. It allowed me the opportunity to appreciate the difference from the one I had been craving and now I think I like theirs even more (at Flavors of India!). Great job guys! Nice service, excellent food and good $$. Definitely seeing you again soon for dinner or lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie appetizer

dP-4FUylxn1o0_ceTIm1_A.text: Even though I ordered the lamb vindaloo at a spiciness of 8, it was only mildly hot. The chutney was hotter. A vindaloo dish is supposed to be one of the hottest Indian dishes. This one was not.  The flavors of all the dishes we ordered was wonderful. Unfortunately, they were not hot enough. I would have needed to order them all at 10 to warm my mouth and excite the senses.   We ordered an Aloo Gobi Masala, chicken jalfrezi, shrimp tikka masala and lamb vindaloo with a side order of naan and rice. To wash down the food we had a Kingfisher beer, a Flying Horse beer, a house Cabernet Sauvignon, and a mango lassi.  We were greeted when we arrived and seated quickly. As it was a Thursday evening at about 6:30, we did not have a reservation, which was not necessary.  The waitress was ready to take our order after we had finished devouring the papadums. The drinks arrived quickly and the food soon after. We had to order a second helping of rice as, for four people, one serving dish was not quite enough.  We had a little food remaining after we had eaten our fill that we were able to pack up and take home for later. Just enough for a snack for two people.  I would return to this restaurant but I would need to make sure that they understood that I really enjoy spicy  food.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Naan, chutney, shrimp tikka masala, aloo gobi marsala.

NxgIsjjB72rkNEjIbP0aWQ.text: Came here with my husband and we LOVED it! Best Indian food we've had to date. Great service, it seems family owned, and they are super sweet and professional. They gave us some recommendations and were helpful when we had questions. I got the chicken curry and I highly recommend! Also the naan here is amazing! We will definitely come back.

dAyPI8zc7kl-claEWmk1FQ.text: What a wonderful experience! We loved the food and we were cared for as family. The owner is so personable. The service was impeccable. The food amazing. We will be visiting again soon. Thank you!

_zuwpCL2d7QgwelXFEXcag.text: I love this place. The buffet is about as fresh as you're going to get at a place like this. They usually have a couple of items that you don't see at other places .  The folks that work here are very, very gracious and friendly. If you want to get them talking, just ask about an item or two . They're all smiles and proud of their cuisine.

WZl4t3wvHdIcqyJuPWP6yQ.text: Wow! What a great find! Was next door at Walk in Wellness and was starving!! I walked over they were so lovely, even though it was just me. Treated me like the queen I think I am! . But seriously, amazing service, great food, lovely interior. The menu was very extensive and caters to everyone. Oh and there are so many different desserts I have to come back just to try them all!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy vegetarian dish.

HTPtRxkXTwcctAqjZOvGQw.text: Simply amazing. I pick it up every Thursday on the way to pick my hubby up. It's our ritual, and we LOVE the food.

B2EoH3mRszSgthNkZyMqig.text: This is a review just based on their lunch buffet, which was wonderful!   I originally wasn't going to check this place out b/c it's a pretty long drive since I live in Tempe and am afraid of driving on the interstate, but I'm glad I did!   The buffet offered about the same variety, if a little more, than most Indian buffets - a couple chutneys, salad fixings, three chicken options, basmati rice just flavored with like cumin seeds, pakora, creamy veg masala, creamy black daal, chana masala, okra, and three deserts (kheer, mango custard, carrot halwa). A basket of naan is brought to the table. North Indian food, with a very mild spice level.   Everything I ate (which was almost everything that didn't have chicken) was very good. If you didn't like North Indian food, which in my experience (esp in restaurants), tends to be richer and often more cream-based, you would not enjoy the buffet, but luckily there is no region of South Asia whose food I haven't enjoyed so I liked it a lot! In particular like - the specific offerings are not especially uncommon, but their execution is just very very tasty.   Service was also very friendly and good - I got the impression it is generally the same woman at the front / seating ppl / checking people out (for which I have limited evidence, but the ppl paying after me called her by name and said "another wonderful lunch" so I made some assumptions), and she was great. Prompt, polite, friendly service.   I probably won't come back TOO often b/c there are nearer-by places I like just as much, but if you live closer and despair at the concentration of Indian buffets in the valley in and around Tempe, you've got a great option in Flavors of India.

rH2fuCd-GnGWOt0iGOhaAQ.text: So far I have been here twice and the food during the buffet is absolutely amazing!! The aroma when you first enter is as welcoming as the lovely host  whom, I'm sure is the owner of the place.  She is incredibly welcoming and friendly. The food is also IN-credible! I must say. Not many other places in town that serve the "baji's"  (fried breaded onions) they do theres very well. I drive clear out from Scottsdale to eat here and I will continue to do so. Thank you "Flavors of India" I am a #1 fan. ps..could only suggest a bit more vegetarian options on the buffet perhaps.

_D7Pzo4v9p61J-Ozo1wz-Q.text: Delicious! Stopped in for lunch & fortunately they were still serving a lunch buffet. They close at 2:30. The food is from Northern India & very tasty. I met the chef/owner & his lovely wife. They are extremely hospitable & take excellent care to make their patrons happy. They change their buffet daily so it's not the same every day. Excellent naan they make fresh as you sit down & desserts are yummy too! Look forward to returning for dinner & seeing their menu options.

HdbuLe9sjF9kl5VTFlNoCQ.text: If you enjoy an Indian buffet, this is your place. This clean, no frills place always has a good number of standard Indian dishes like chicken tikka masala, chicken curry and more. There is always a lentil dish and spinach or Cauliflower.  If I had any complaints, it would be too offer more than an array of chicken dishes and to mix it up more with lamb, beef or fish. However, the spice level is relatively mild and they bring fresh, hot Naan to your table. The staff is very pleasant and service is prompt. If you're in a hurry, this place will have you in and out during their lunch buffet in no time flat.  We will return again and again over the coming years!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vp77QRpCmFVYcj6_Iqk_fA.text: This was my first time in this restaurant. The place looks ok, dusty. The food was good I tried the Lamb biryani which was very good for my taste. Chicken tika masala was also very tasty and good balance with the spices. The garlic naan was one of my favorite breads. I would totally come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YpYkbLTwxTGIrPgU5hEgOA.text: Tried this place on a whim last week with my son. It's nicely decorated and I enjoyed the Bollywood music videos on their tv. We ordered Lamb Vindaloo and the Chicken Tandoori Murg Masala...both were very good, loved the spices, chicken and lamb were tender. We also had Basmati rice /Vegetable Biryani which is my favorite and Mango Lassi to drink. It's family run...they are very friendly, eager to give advice on what to try and just make you feel at home. I do recommend coming here. It's a little bit pricey but we don't have Indian food very often. I will come back to try their buffet sometime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lamb Vindaloo and Tandoori Murg Masala

WTfEEAZtNqKmYlXLUrRAKw.text: Great service!! Excellent food! I think I just ate the best chicken dish I have ever had!!!

0Wu36dltZ5N2JE8SJhhDFQ.text: I had a very good dinner here but the subsequent lunch buffet left something to be desired. Just the most of those were very dry. Also I was in a rush and even though I had not gone back for seconds when I asked if I could take a to go box I was categorically refused which did not leave a great impression with me

MykQHp2ENPuEN9tAa4dTNA.text: I truly love Indian food and I wanted to like this place more, but I ultimately couldn't. I wound up at the lunch buffet and didn't think too much of it. The dishes at the buffet really lacked the oomph that I am so used to at Indian restaurants, and unless the pot was personally stirred, some of the dishes were room temperature. As far as pricing, it wasn't too bad; it was just around $10.   After reading other reviews (Mainly Lisa O's) I would consider trying this place after the buffet is put away. But until then, I'll probably just be staying away.

Jb14HL-_ZGmLZDDBXrQzjQ.text: I really like the following dishes from here:  Curry Tikka Masala Buttered Chicken Mango Chicken Naan  Now be warned, several of the dishes, from my sampling of the menu, are essentially identical with perhaps a slight twist that makes it different based on a technicality. It's akin to two soups being different because one has mushrooms but the other one doesn't.   You can't go wrong using naan with the four dishes I listed, their naan is soft and not too thick or thin (though I've had friends say they thought it was on the thin side).  I am not a huge fan of the mango lassi that they make here. It's got a little too much milk and not enough mango.   The chai tea here is decent, but don't get it to go. I've heard that the lunch buffet here is good, but can't make it over here during to daytime to check it out.

PiPBuYvWNBKkjTjULEnzEQ.text: The food is pretty tasty, no complaints there.  The atmosphere is quiet and a little awkward at dinner time. Also, I asked for a side of chutney and they charged $3 for a little cup.  It really feels like you are being nickled and dimed. It isn't really a good value either.  I would recommend taking the food to-go or maybe going at lunch.

hkKtMH-N6di36GCk8vMIzQ.text: I have always been curious about this place, but I feel most wouldn't because of the outside appearance. The service here is OUTSTANDING. Very friendly and very efficient!!! That alone will send me back :) It is very cozy and quiet inside. They have a dish that sizzles and steams a lot when brought out so it has a fun presentation. Food is definitely good. Not exactly outstanding, but enough to keep me coming back. Five stars!

DCKAhpjXmPu3AalLhQ1e0g.text: $10 for a delicious lunch buffet?  Yes please!  The owners are super nice and the food is quality.  Love this place!

VfAw7azchRys4L-kQGw39Q.text: Best authentic Indian food! Best lunch buffet everyday special only $10-$12!! We love the authentic feel of the restaurant and the genuine hospitality from all the employees and owners!! I'm so thankful for the amazing quality and big large portions. Thank you keep up the good work!!

xbcnnmirMgbBoQf1tg5hVQ.text: Really delicious. The butter chicken is soooo good. The samosas we ordered for an appetizer were really fresh. And the garlic naan is an absolute must addition to any meal. I've tried many Indian places through out the USA, and this is among the best of them. You should go, don't even think twice about it.

npV9k6aVCjXgyymgdWJNvg.text: Chicken Tikka Meh-Sala ------------------------- Hey! An Indian restaurant in central Phoenix! How about that? Awesome, right?  Um. Don't get too excited, O.  I get seated in a booth by the front door and survey the scene. Groups and dates of people eating. Flat screen panel showing a sequence of 2006's most craptastic Bollywood videos. Bar stocked with Johnny Walker Black Label, because if you're Indian, that's what you drink. Mango lassi is for wusses.  I order ground chicken samosas, boneless chicken kebabs, and lamb vindaloo with rice, naan, and raita. Complementary papadum and chutney is placed on my table. Soon after 4 dinky samosas arrive on a small plate. They were ok. Meh is more like it.  Then I wait a LONG time (20+ minutes) for my entrees. I know grilling chicken takes a while, but these were small boneless pieces - I know it's not supposed to take longer than 4 music videos of Indian hero boy and Indian heroine girl disco dancing in the forest and then all of a sudden a rainstorm and her sari is wet....  ....where was I? Oh yeah. People who came in and ordered 10-15 mintes after I did received their food within 8-10 minutes. That kind of annoyed me. I seethed a little, but only to myself, because I'm suave like that.  Eventually my dinner shows up. Chicken pieces in a sizzling platter. Vindaloo served in an antique metal bowl. Good on the presentation, I'll give them that.  The naan was crisp, which is a good plus, because the divine whomevers ruling the universe will strike upon those, the evil misguided purveyors of the Earth's soggy, limp naans. Oh, they will be struck down, mark my words.   The chicken, for it taking so long, was very tender and juicy but really mediocre tasting. Mediocre to the point where I recognized the jarred tandoori sauce they marinated the chicken in. So not good to do, my Indian restaurantering friends.   The vindaloo was alright...but with really small cubes of lamb and potatoes. I asked for them to make all of my food really spicy, because, well, I'm brown like they are and that's how we roll. But they took it as to make it as bland as possible. Maybe they thought I was an 87-year old English man named Alistair for whom even a sprinkle of crushed black pepper would set his mouth on fire. Who knows.  What I do know is that I was disappointed something huge. An Indian restaurant so close to where I live, and yet so debatable whether if I'm ever going to go back.  So two stars (maybe a little greater than two, like two-and-a-third) for the Indian food and Indian service equivalent of  beige. Decent ambiance and friendly host-owner, though, so hey, if you're in the 'hood and are hankering for some curried meh, you've got your ideal place right here. You can thank me later by performing your own Bollywood video.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4iy5d9bbXOM4QG8GJTjigg.text: The food here is AWESOME!!  The Chicken Curry is especially delicious.  The  staff is very attentive, and the decor is very nice.

P-uxtyrVraU4g75oVjhfiw.text: We order 2 plates chilly chicken, but it is so hard to find chicken in it.  They cooked it with 75% of onions,  capsicum and 25% of chicken.  They should change dish name, it should be "chilly capsicum" instead of "chilly chicken".  Worst dish!!!   Don't ever order chilly chicken here.

5mjPOor5Nxc8vWN3GXdbxA.text: Just delicious!  Got the chicken Korma and the sag chicken, medium spice, with a mixed bread basket.  So flavorful and well prepared, with some leftovers (I was there with a friend and we shared the two).  Highly recommend!

kADZAMKtiT_V27t-MH5wxQ.text: I had a "bogo" from my credit card points and was looking for something other then the usual burger type restaurant to try out in Phoenix. Flavors of India popped up and I went with a friend. The decor was nice, service as well and the food ok but I was perhaps hoping for something a tad tastier. It's not located near me and therefore not one I would put on my "let's drive to xyz" for dinner but if you're in the neighborhood it's good enough to make it your "local Indian restaurant". Look forward to discovering more in the Valley and seeing if I was wrong in my first assumptions.

9nGK6bKiQ-Yp5kJKdxQrEg.text: The food tasted very old. Rice was had hard pieces in it, as if it was from the day before. Chicken was dry as if it was frozen and then re-heated.  The water container that they filled with water. had stuff floating in it. It was very hot and humid in the restaurant and when confronted they had nothing to say. I will never be back. My first time here was in 2010 and I thought it was good back then. Now

YjDz8P_6flcPBOYgjPY5OQ.text: Everything was burned and the samosas were a Joke I'm Indian and this was not good $13.00 for lunch buffet

P3MyODa7v70zSrNm-ECMzQ.text: Bada bing, bad food and great service, decor is also a little different but okay, won't be returning!

jVlFwRokPFI5jV21b2kqMg.text: This is a pleasant Indian restaurant. During the week they have a lunch buffet for ten bucks. It has limited offerings and is not especially spicy, but nevertheless the food is tasty & I managed to get my fill!  The staff is pleasant, which is a plus for an Indian restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OH8Ni1cDhocC_9U085NXBg.text: Always delicious! Lunch buffet is so yummy, fresh and full of choices (meat & veg). Dinner menu is hard to choose from due to the extensive variety. The chicken tikka Masala is rich and flavorful. Definitely a favorite. Garlic naan is also a must! The atmosphere is clean and open, and the wait staff are attentive and sweet. I lololove this restaurant!

bM0vbvNCRaV_hK3M-ZJcrg.text: My favorite Indian restaurant. I was taken here first on a job interview when I flew into town. Remained a regular stop for me for last 10 years. I still visit any chance I get when in Phoenix. Lunch buffet has only a few dishes but they excellent and fresh.

3d7f9nt6qBlBvo4Kx_mvvA.text: A decent pick where Indian lunch buffet is scarce in the area.  Living in the east valley I may be a bit spoiled or picky when it comes to options for Indian food for lunch. For Phoenix when options are limited this place definitely meets the mark.  Options are limited and mainly focus on veg or chicken. Quality and taste though is superb and can't complain. Unlimited garlic naan is always welcome.  There were a few items that went quick and took a while to get back out or didn't even make it back for the lunch rush.

N4oBp8vZe2vb0OqovJkc5w.text: I was looking for Indian food around me and I stumbled upon this place. When you walk in, it has a very traditional/ homey feel. It is a family owned restaurant (from what I observed). They tended to us very well and checked up on us regularly.  I had the lamb tikka masala, medium heat, rice and garlic naan. OMG it's so good and full of flavor! I've ordered the same thing for take out a few times now. Medium heat is perfect. It has a little kick at the end, but not too spicy that you can't finish or enjoy the taste. The garlic naan is delirious as well   I've had the chicken before, but I definitely feel like the lamb has more flavor (two of my friends have tried both and they agree with me).

ojQQ-gfwCIMlJaZjchceDw.text: The place is nice and clean, and their workers are very friendly. We ordered a mild chicken tikka masala but we didn't even taste a hint of spiciness. It was still good though! It tasted a bit sweet. Then, we ordered chicken biryani and garlic naan because their entrees doesn't come with naan or rice. Usually a lot of indian places give you a serving of naan for free. This place is on the pricey side, but at least the food is pretty good.  Their service is a bit slow though. My boyfriend and I were literally the only ones in there for dinner at 8pm, but it took them at least 10 minutes to take our order and another 20-25 minutes to get us our food.   Giving it four stars for the friendly service and because the food was above average, but not sure I will keep coming back just because I've been to other better indian places.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Biryani, Garlic Naan, Chicken Tikka Masala

ipaf77m2sAftUwgIK-WNiA.text: The place was right next to my apartment so i HAD to check out their lunch buffet. For the price, the buffet was worth it! 2nd time i went, some currys were bland and I had to add a lot of salt. But honestly, for the price, i couldnt complain! They bring out unlimited naan bread as well :)

azsBFzsxen7nusEWY6l90A.text: Some of the best curry I've had in AZ. This place is a must if you like authentic Indian food!

LKUtOYz7849VwlHaiLipRQ.text: Bad food and extremely rude customer service!  We came in after following the good reviews. Unfortunately the experience wasn't pleasant at all.Pls note that we got seated by a server followed by a different server who took our our order and finally other different server who served our food.  We ordered two chai, samosa, aloo paratha, and chicken Tikka wings since we just wanted some Indian appetizers. Our chai (tea) was too bitter and lacked milk. I make masala chai every morning so I know what a good chai looks like. Having shared the issue with the second server (apparently she seemed like the owner) she gave us some extra milk. However, it was of no use. Our tea had some green particles in it. I showed it to the server, she took our tea, came back with the same cup of tea and said it's Celantro. Seriously??? She didn't even apologise and insisted it was just Celantro. Even if it was, aren't you supposed to take out the cilantro and serve us a different cup of chai??? Isn't that how it suppose to work or I am expecting too much as a customer?  Next, the aloo paratha was dry and uncooked. No butter spread at all on top of the paratha.  Lastly, the wings, it  read "prepared in CLAY oven" in the menu. So we expected it to be char grilled. But it wasn't. Rather it tasted different. Again, we shared our concern and the same owner server started playing defensive. She kept insisting and arguing that there was nothing wrong with the chicken. Later,  she went to talk with the chef, came back after few minutes, and said that it was cooked in ELECTRONIC oven, that's why it lacked smoky flavor. OMG, I have never been to any restaurant with this level of disrespect and bad attitude towards customers and the food they serve. Please get your facts correct and display the same in your menu so that customers are not misguided.   The experience was a total disaster. Very rude customer service and bad food, no authenticity. It clearly felt like they were just trying to make money. No respect for the food they prepare and serve. After all this, they still charged us th full price for all the items (we threw all the food especially the chicken, barely even touched it). Never going back again.

Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Raw Samosa
Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States

31zcMoHiECH7QIKMKX-5Vw.text: This place really hits the spot.  We spontaneously went for a Friday night dinner. It's a good place for a family dinner. It's not very fancy or a scene by any means. It is a lovely family restaurant with good quality food. We had the mango lassi, and I ordered and extra one to go because it was so tasty. The dishes were all flavorful. We had garlic naan which had just the right amount of chewiness and crunch. Happy to have this place as a new go to!

7lrgrPo2bNyjtte7kghqxw.text: If there's one flavor of India to eat of the many at Flavors of India, go for the chicken makhani/butter chicken. As one of my friends so eloquently stated, "I want to bathe in this stuff!" XD The flavors are incredible, with its magic blend of spices, butter, and tomatoey, creamy sauce, perfectly seasoned. It was one of the dishes at the lunch buffet here. When we went they had tandoori chicken legs, chicken curry (Bone in dark meat), chicken makhani, palak paneer, aloo gobi, dal (Yellow lentils), with three different pakoras, chana masala, and a salad bar off to the side. Desserts included carrot halva and mango pudding. Basmati rice is also at the buffet and they will bring you freshly baked naan to your table as well. I enjoyed all the elements in the buffet and service was very friendly.   The total price when I checked out at the front was $12. Overall it's not a bad deal for all you can eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Naan
Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Buffet sample

48avh1IG5YizeWhJggTMzA.text: Stellar service by very attentive wait staff.  Free papadam refills at table.  Multiple soda refills offered as soon as your glass was empty.  Tasty traditional northern Indian food.  Ironically the menu clearly denotes the meat dishes under a header labeled "Non-vegetarian dishes" as if the vegetarian dishes are the norm/default way of eating.  I found that very charming.  The portions are extremely generous. You get a huge bowl of rice with your meal for just $.99.  This is a very solid place close to everything in the Biltmore/Camelback area.  We'd definitely eat here again.

1jJUAksw5cFkvX_LwvvYyA.text: They remodeled this place. It still isn't "hip" but the decor is nice and refreshed.  Lunch buffet is the bomb. Three vegetarian options, 4 meat choices.  They rotate the lunch buffet options.  This place and its owners are awesome

6ur4BOvVA6BhQALy4gJuJA.text: Really good flavors, consistently impressive spicing, and friendly service. I'm impressed by this restaurant, so much so that I came back twice in the span of a couple days.   There's a large parking lot outside, the inside is clean if a little dated, and there is booth as well as table seating. Lunch includes buffet and to-order dishes, while dinner is just to-order.  Buffet: Most of the buffet dishes are either made with chicken or vegetables, but there was a good variety. There were cream-based dishes, curry dishes, lentils, spinach-based dishes, and paneer. Plain naan is included, as well as rice. There are some raw vegetables including cucumbers and ice berg lettuce, not to mention tomatoes and onions. Desserts included rice pudding, mango pudding, and fried balls of dough in sugar syrup. While not as good as their to-order dishes, I thought that this was one of the better lunch buffets I've had.  Lamb curry: This was my absolute favorite rendition of this dish that I've ever had. Curries usually taste pretty one-dimensional to me despite all the spices, but this was not the case. There was a great balance of savory and sweet, the consistency was just right (sometimes curries can be too liquidy for me), and the lamb was cooked until it was tender but not overdone. It was so good that I was tempted to order another to take back.  Lamb korma: I really liked the flavoring of this dish as well, although it was heavier than the lamb curry because it was cream-based. Even so, I thought the balance was definitely there, and the meat was cooked well.   Garlic naan and rice: I liked that the rice was seasoned, but not so seasoned that it interfered with the other dishes. The garlic naan could have used a little more garlic for my taste, but it was cooked well and airy and soft.  I think I've found my favorite Indian restaurant in the area, and I'll surely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garlic naan.
Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lamb korma.
Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seasoned rice.

zz5-Xv9YrE0-dvs2z1tDQw.text: I think I might have just found my goto for Indian food! Indian food is one of my favorite ethnic dishes to eat. Unfortunately, I've struggled to find good flavorful Indian food that wasn't all the way over in Tempe. Not anymore!  So I called in a Chicken Tikka Masala , 2 orders of garlic naan, and some basmati rice. They asked me how hot I wanted it! This is a good sign as most of the other places don't even ask. I say spicy. They did not disappoint! The curry was the perfect consistency, not watery or too thick. The spice level was close to perfect - could have gone up a level for me. The garlic naans tasted fresh and delicious. This was enough food to split for 2 people as they give generous portions.   All in all I'm beyond excited to find a good quality Indian place that is nearby. Their menu selection is vast, their prices are decent, portions are generous, and the quality of food is very good. I will be coming back to try their other dishes!

t4Qb8csz4q2ERcXaSxdblg.text: I love your buffet and the impeccable customer service. Flavors of India takes pride in a clean and upscale environment. The buffet options can rotate but you can always count on your favorite dishes to be there.

r7xDeVS4sdA60WAQ_HdO2w.text: So good, had amazing Indian food in Boston and I was nervous about the possibility of not finding a place in phx. I waited about 50 min to an hour for my to-go order which was supposed to take 30 min so I recommend ordering ahead of time and taking your time to get there. Regardless, worth the wait! The workers are also very sweet and are glad to give you a table and ice water while you wait for your order. The wait time is the only reason I give this 4 stars, if they told me it would be an hour then it'd be okay but I hate being told it'll be way less than what it actually takes and I'm left waiting for an unknown amount of time

9_MS0sTqheONVsNdC0SXjw.text: I love this place SO Much. Amazing food and friendly staff. Excited to go by on the weekend and try the buffet.  The veggie Marsala was delicious and the garlic naan. We also tried the vegetarian sampler appetizer. Ask for mango chutney to go with the sampler. It was the only thing I think they should add to the sampler or the table.

PhHUBSuixqFaMxZNVjz49A.text: I have been here a few times.  Chicken tikka masala is creamy and has good flavor.  Garlic naan is my go to.  Customer service is excellent.  They always treated good.  Lunch buffet is definitely worth a try if you like Indian food.  Food is not spicy but still tastes good.

uXfCiJhAMyd579UBL4Hp-Q.text: Great Indian takeout in midtown. We've had chicken tikka masala, butter chicken, plain and garlic naan. Everything was great. The garlic naan was a little too garlicky for me, but my husband liked it. Ordering was easy and everything was ready quickly. Will definitely be ordering again.

fk-ss4hgVwutCxrmyy94dw.text: Overall, I thought this was a mediocre place. I'm not a connoisseur of Indian cuisine, but I feel like I've had much better tikka masala. I did think that their lamb vindaloo had really good flavor though. Their garlic naan didn't have much of a garlic flavor and I wish it had more of a fluffy texture. We also tried their sampler platter of some of their meats and once again I thought it was okay. The prices are also a little expensive. Their rice was really good and seasoned nice. Not sure if I will be back, but if I will then it will probably just be for the vindaloo.

KajpJV4cqS8MEek5r14CMg.text: So, to start all I have to say is TRY, TRY, TRY this delicious food!  My Partner had come to this restaurant in hopes of it being better than a past place we have tried. We won't mention.   And all we can say is that we were blown away! The food was absolutely delicious and packed with so much flavor and love. The atmosphere was calming, relaxing and also had a bit of flare to it. We thought it was beautiful! And the service that was given to us.... Some of the absolute best. Our server, host and manager (owner) of the restaurant was so attentive, caring and you can tell they took pride in the food and quality in which they have provided.  I can't not remember the names of the exact dishes we have ordered but I didn't forget to take some pictures of the most delicious Indian food I have ever tasted in Arizona.  From the homemade warm soft bread, to the mouth watering flavorful chicken, everything was absolutely delicious. Even to the desserts we had order. Nothing about this placed can disappoint. Leaving with a full belly and a warm chai tea to go! We couldn't have asked for a better way to end the night!   We definitely plan on coming back time after time.  Just everything about Flavors of India was superb.  Absolutely some of the best food and best service We have had in a very long time!

u9aT_fzoFfjDT36b3f5zGg.text: This is the best Indian food in Phoenix as far as my husband and I are concerned! They makes it as spicy as you'd like. The Lamb Curry is a must try!

Pql1ShNz_ucYqXosiKxUaA.text: Love this place! They have great vegetarian options and everything I have tried here is so delicious!!! Very friendly and sweet family that runs it and they always take great care of us when we come in:)  **Try the Mushroom Mutter! Its awesome!

IjBFoLOz62a53_vNMMMwLw.text: Substandard at best. Garlic Nan was a regular nan, and out of the 4 pieces, 2 were like hockey pucks. Of course I was charged for the garlic nan. Won't be back!

fUPq0Z_gF7hSYphNz02jzA.text: This place was absolutely amazing. Very nice atmosphere and awesome service. The food was delicious too. I took my vegetarian friend here because he didnt know how many amazing (and flavorful) vegetarian options Indian food offered. It was a superb experience. ^_^ We came for dinner but they have lunch buffet too. All in all a pretty neat place.

qW-KMcgSqBGbAUmGOQ6rOQ.text: Best pakora we've ever had, but everything else was just ok. Good quality but kinda bland in flavor. Definitely no spice / heat factor. They only serve regular naan not garlic for the buffet.

Ou7-0vmK0MwPfRaM_BfZTg.text: We reached 5 mins before the restaurant was closing  and the owner welcomed us without any tantrums. We ordered paneer masala and dal makhni. The food was amazing in taste and super delicious. The Mango lassi was perfect what I always wanted. The best part was their hospitality which was really great. Over all I would definitely visit this place if I visit Arizona again.

nYgpws9skVuAXSY3evrn2Q.text: My favorite Indian spot in AZ! I love everything about this place. The owners have always been super friendly to us. I've never tried their lunch buffet but their dinner service is phenomenal. The chicken vindaloo is my favorite dish along with the garlic naan. I love that you can choose the spice level on anything you order. I like my dishes spicy... Even extra spicy and they always accommodate.

Fr-4efG_GH5bA4uluN7jPA.text: I think this place is 3 and a half stars. It is a fair-to-good, family-run restaurant, and because it is the only Indian place I know of in central Phoenix, I've been there quite a few times, only for dinner.  The atmosphere is comfortable and relaxed, with kind service, booth seating and Bollywood videos to entertain you. It's not the kind of place to take a date you want to impress, but it's the kind of place to go with your friends for a pretty good meal.  Last time I tried their frozen dessert (forget the name of it) and it was lovely, a delicate blend of spices that was the perfect finish to the meal.

GmNweQR-4gOujlMhYz-pxQ.text: Recipe for lunch success: park easily, eat immediately, flavorful food, attentive service, quick payment. Favors of India is my go-to lunch spot during the week. The all you can eat buffet for $10 is the bomb.com. I dream about their delicious buttery toasted naan and rich chicken masala. The restaurant is clean, and service is fast and attentive - because we are eating plate after plate after plate. Best Indian food in the area. We walk in and make a beeline to the buffet...like, before even finding a table. Where else can you eat within two seconds of walking in?! Nowhere.

wgTTb-N7PlbcyIXkoGmInw.text: I have never had anything here that was not excellent. The staff is friendly. The atmosphere is great. There is something for everyone and the food is not too spicy if you do not want it to be.

PAZukEZ0o4i8UecKcvvv9g.text: This place is a run down dump. I felt like l was going to get a mersa infection just sitting at the table. The food is terrible, even for lndian food. The buffet is over priced. There are some great Indian places in Phoenix and this is not one. You can just tell that they do things as cheap as possible and don't care about quality. My guess is that the chef is mexican and not lndian! Move along.

cy8Nfr_Dl7WNA51y3K2Vkw.text: My husband and I always drive by this place on our way to work so we thought we would finally stop in as we love indian food. There was a group of five in the center of the restaurant that was enjoying themselves it seemed but other than that it was empty. We were offered some thin flat and crispy cracker type thing and a dipping sauce which was nice and some water, it didn't take long for our server to ask what our order was. We got the masala and butter chicken. We had to order the rice and naan separate, other places gave those along with the meal. The food was ok, not amazing but not bad either, the naan was only one piece and the prices were kind of high for what you get. Service was friendly but not enough to make us go back.

CPX1fuFLGB8sPPxw-MGOng.text: Just finished with the lunch buffet here and I must say they exceeded my expectations. The service was great and the food was better. I will definitely go back and order off the dinner menue. If thd buffet was this good I'm sure the dinner items can only be better.

20ocfRhfDASGQkk2vWiSQg.text: The bread served was either left overs from other customer or was eaten by some rodent , when we brought this issue to staffs notice ,  The staff was very very rude . when we asked for owner , The owner itself was rude and asked us to never visit the restaurant again .  So be careful what you eat

NwV_WXDNNeLChhMr416AgQ.text: Wow... We came from California for a office trip and this place was close to work. first the place was totally empty and owner was peeping out at entry door which was creepy. We thought of giving them a chance and wow food was pathetic. And when we talked with the owner about food, his reply was this is what it is. If u want it eat otherwise u can leave. I don't recommend this place to anyone.

zJf3VQc3ksuTnfhG0mmrig.text: This restaurant is near our home so we have visited it on quite a few occasions - always for dinner. The food has always been pretty good, though in recent months, we've noticed that the recipes have been substantially improved. We find that we are more frequent diners nowadays.  Today, flavors are more distinct and better balanced. The Vindaloo has has an appropriate tartness against the spice. The tomato-based curries are richer, with a good balance of salt and sweet. We like hot dishes, but usually order them "medium" for our friends - and that has worked very well, with everyone enjoying the dishes.   Their location in a strip mall off 16th street doesn't look like much in the evenings, with all the other businesses closed and standard LED open signs flashing, but inside the restaurant is clean and nicely appointed, though admittedly it can be a little too dim for some folks. We could live without the endless Bollywood clips on the TV screen in the dining room (just the bar would be okay), but they do make for comical dinner conversation on occasion.  Service is always genuine, efficient and friendly. Big, cold Indian premium beers are always welcome on a hot Phoenix night and they are served with tall, cold glasses.  Take it from a long-time Phoenix resident that loves Thai, Indian, Cuban and Mexican food -  if you're looking for good Indian food in the Central corridor, try this restaurant for dinner. It doesn't look like much on the outside, but there's always parking and it's very good.

cgeh7F_SYCmRGOo1q9st0Q.text: Worst food ever I had in my life in all Indian resturant I tried in my life I ordered tikka masala and mix grill platter each chicken piece was more than half pound worst garlic naan... I was hungry but I Cudnt eat anything my money was wasted

8Bim08pWrTV17VZs3W9eHg.text: Absolutely love the lunch buffet! Everything was so flavorful. Huge menu to choose from also. My favs are Mango Lassi & the rice pudding. Definitely will be back to try dinner here.

hVsOHcpah8layOtpt4CpXA.text: so the wife and I love to get Indian buffet at this place. The food is always fresh, the service is always good and BONUS*** They always play those Indian music videos with everybody dancing!!!    I prefer doing the buffet thing because I only know a few dishes that I like. It's about $10 a person, and you will not leave hungry. The Tandoori chicken here is the best I've ever had and they have plenty of vegetarian dishes, if that's your bag. I sometimes get buffet takeout, and eat Indian food all day for about $10. If your looking for some good Indian food or never tried it and are looking for some variety, this is the place!

nUNA3cjq33_HlgeQLOPECA.text: I've been eating here for years and quite frankly this review is overdue! I always get the chicken makhani and it never disappoints. The lunch buffet is great if you want to try and get adventurous or stick to what you know. But above all, the staff is awesome! They always remember I order a coke with my meal. I come in with my two year old niece from time to time and they ask me about her. It's awesome to know the staff remembers things like that. Definitely will remain a loyal customer!

QGAE74c80koMY3lUNRORFg.text: Food was ok. Service was poor. Saw a roach near our table. Not my choice for a lunch companion!

x40XB1GnlVjNM4ysSbW0Pg.text: I've been for dinner and the lunch buffet, and I prefer the variety that the lunch buffet has to offer.  The first time I went for dinner, I asked for spicy, and it was a bit more than I anticipated, but I can't complain because it is what I asked for, I just wasn't ready. The lunch buffet was delicious, there is an excellent variety of food available, good for vegetarian and meat lovers. Everything was flavorful, and spiced perfectly. I left perfectly satisfied. I have only two complaints. 1. It is beyond cold in there, so make sure to bring a sweater or something warm with you if you are sensitive to cold. 2. I notice that the staff only asks Indian patrons if they would like roti's or naan with their buffet. I was just given naan without a question, which I ate, but I definitely would have chosen a roti had I been offered the choice.

AizICSzI-CRzHq7yb1Bt7w.text: The 2nd time was better than the first! It's our favorite Indian restaurant now  the chicken tikka masala is excellent. The garlic and cheese nans were fabulous. We'll be back!

WB4YeI3eLaCXJ1oRFzA2Tg.text: So good! I went with my family (including some toddlers) and everyone LOVED the food. Great options for sharing and overall fun experience!

IajqCShiENm9XIULlzMwNg.text: This is just another curry house. Yellow daal and chile pakora is pretty good. Unfortunately for us True lovers of authentic indian/pakistani/bengali food, this place is one of many very average restaurants

-Maa9nrQ6ENW7IBu9gV0ew.text: Wonderful service, clean and comfortable. Everything on the menu is delicious. They have a great lunch buffet, and large dinner menu

uAVRj7LPTZpxWXVGt8Co5Q.text: My 2nd time here! Excellent food ... Service is good and quick! Love the lunch Buffett!!!

1PDkb1hGpiHaotW9jqvbwg.text: I absolutely love this place! Great food and the owner Sima is a sweetheart. Tikka masala is the best in town not to mention the perfect flaky and delicious samosas

4QxcB09YrUPKGNO1CerLDw.text: Thank you for the most amazing dinner tonight - we are from Chicago and we were incredibly impressed. We will be back. Thank you so, so much!  Highlights were delicious fish, peas and potato, chai and dessert. Elegant, sumptuous and friendly. Pure gratitude.

MCoiQjBKt977FrNjWibDnA.text: Flavors were decent. They had about 7 different tubs of dishes to scoop from and a salad-type bar on the side. All the flavors weren't too different from one another - one more herby or one more spicy. The chicken dishes were well seasoned and relatively moist. They give you naan upon seating and you can ask for more. The naan is plain or... buttery? I typically love love love rice pudding, but this place makes it... interesting. It tasted ok, but it was thick. It had other goodies in it like almonds or something.   Staff was attentive, but don't expect any smiles or warm fuzzy freindly feeling. Also, check your silverware... I changed out my fork 4 times because there was still dried food on it. The last fork I got still had dried food on it... but I was actually able to scrape it off with my napkin for this one. yeah...

Hg6YI9ivKUQH2AhSfuPMoQ.text: Looking for a fantastic lunch buffet?? Look no further. Flavors of India is amazing and they have a fantastic mix of old favorites and new flavors.

82W1W59aAnEPG4LIrND4xA.text: This is my favorite Indian restaurant in the entire valley. If you like Indian food and buffets, this is the place to go. There's really nothing that was bad about this place, (that I noticed, anyway) ALL FIVE STARS

zonqgysfjDRw3EiMbCzluA.text: I'm finding more and more great places to eat in the central Phoenix area and I can add this to the list,  thanks to fellow yelpers Rand H and Mike C who invited me to join them for lunch buffet here. Seating is ample, with booths available. Lighting is toned down to a comfortable level and the TV screen playing Bollywood dance videos had the sound turned down.  I enjoyed pretty much every item in the lunch buffet. The main dishes were really savory; I especially liked the onion and cauliflower pakora. The  heat level of the dishes that were spicy was just right for me. The two desserts offered - mango pudding and rice pudding - were superb and an excellent way to cap a great meal. Service was very efficient, and the cost of the buffet was 10 bucks, tax included - truly a great deal.
