RV-xEf93juyDCvLOQ98TYg.text: This is probably our favorite Indian restaurant in Phoenix. As always, we had great food and great service. Papadum crackers were brought to the table with 2 Indian dipping sauces to start. They were very busy last night - It was a Friday night. My husband had the combination tandoori dinner with chicken, lamb (which were meatballs), and shrimp. He said it was excellent. I'm vegan, so had an entree with chickpeas which I ordered medium spicy...very spicy and yummy! We ordered a side of rice and roti bread. My husband enjoyed a cup of their chai tea. It is already made and served with milk in it. We had way too much food so happily packed our leftovers to take home. We had an Entertainment Book coupon which we used, but will definitely be back more times in the next year.

mt44KUU1RUFmRKCwEsFUdg.text: I got tiki masala and chicken korma for takeout from them the other night and the flavors are great as I is the price but the chicken had a funny taste. I love Indian food and I like to try new places but honestly probably won't order from here again because when meat tastes funny that's not okay.

yo5jQyyGkblcRaMND4X9Kg.text: This place made me cheat on my other favorite Indian place in Phoenix. Actually, I left my other favorite Indian place in Phoenix. Their Paneer Tikka Masala is that seductive.  This place is great to go for the buffet, but don't let that distract you from their amazing entrees on the menu. They might seem a bit heavy on price, but they're easily large enough to split with another person, or split into two meals. They have so many for all meats and tons of vegetarian options. This place also has great garlic naan, but don't let that distract you from their amazing regular naan.   I also want to point out that the service here is really good. The staff are so friendly, especially if they start seeing you regularly, and you can just really tell that they love their business. If you or a friend loves Indian food, I would make yourself a friend of Flavors of India.  Also, they're a coke place!

ivE-cLvLbvQQIaRA25RE-w.text: As soon as I walked into this place the staff here was so welcoming and kind (I was wearing some cloggs coming from a pedicure and they still welcomed me) and sat my friend and I right away. Great food! I got the chicken curry and a mango lassi yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken curry, white rice, chicken biryani, and a mango lassi!

2XYZmqUWHxVdmP0-C6qGKQ.text: My newest last meal.   When I die, I'm going to miss my crummy Dallas Cowboys and eating. Finally, a place that gives me what I want!!!  Extra extra hot and spicy, extra garlic chicken vindaloo. Get it if you love the spice.    Join me.

0DhFQ05wX4wt1I0jImawNg.text: Excellent and fresh food. I ordered the chicken curry medium hot. Mind you, India and Pakistani food medium (hot) is Hot! Goodness gracious. The curry cleared up my sinuses for sure. Next time, I will order mild. Other than that my food order was good.  Also the customer service was excellent and friendly. Great customer service at any establishment is super important to me. In addition, the delivery of my food order came out in adequate time! Something any customer can appreciate.   The only things I didn't like about the establishment, is, it needs a renovation and/or makeover. The resturant's decorations appeared 1990ish!   Key B's Recommendation: To appreciate good customer service. Also prompt delivery of ordered food. Desire to eat something different, I recommend the Taste of India!

wYp24lWlj1R9eGyKFmqtbw.text: I am in Phoenix for business and I always have a craving for Indian food. I asked around the office where I could find some great Indian Food! I am pretty simple when it comes to indian food, all I want is butter chicken rice and naan oh and Mango Lassi. I ordered the food to go and was so excited to get back to my hotel room to devour this food.   To my surprise, the butter chicken taste like Tomato soup with chicken in it. I know the butter chicken is a tomato base but this butter chicken was not very good. Maybe I went on a bad day.

OdDWPmlFYp6PpBtc8KaGnw.text: First time expierience here and I enjoyed it! I had the buffet and tried a little bit of everything. The food was pretty good although some of it seemed somewhat bland. Really loved some of the dishes and the dessert. Service was alright, but you don't really need help with a buffet, right? Anyway it was pretty good, but seemed kind of expensive to me? Maybe if I ate more it would seem like a better deal. I'll be back I'm sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Buffet and mango lassie !

9h6MTQM-60ymPgTZA_So0A.text: It took me a long while to write this review because I really wanted to like this place... And I did in a sense. I liked their cleanliness, ambiance, and just on service alone, this place should be 5 stars, but I had to leave room for other important things.... Like the food:/ I have been in an Indian Buffet tryout lately, and this one sadly scores the lowest on food. Which is funny because it is the one with the highest price tag. So, they charge an extra dollar or 2 than others ($11) but they offer no lamb... Or goat! It was very disappointing to find not many options of meat, except for the curry chicken and the chicken leg. I was actually moving all around outside the buffet thinking I was missing a line of other buffet options, but nope... That was it! I tell you something though. Their chapati (flatbread) is the best. It has like a hint of garlic and butter on top, and it was hot and fresh, so that most definitely saved the day, but not enough for me to be back. Just personally.

eDo1UsuOufZVRQh6MwzcUw.text: Awesome authentic delicious.   The food is so good it's now my favorite Indian restaurant. The okra and chicken dishes were so spot on.  Tuesday is when they have the best Buffett.   I also have to say the staff is so sweet and caring it's refreshing   Thank you

0vcCmGka39zb3_5w_C1zkQ.text: Ordered take out so I cannot say anything about the service. I got chicken tikka masala, vegetable pakora, garlic naan, and side of raita.   Chicken tikka masala was delicious---especially for here in Phoenix. It's hard to find good Indian food around here. This is the best in the surrounding area.   Vegetable pakora was pretty good.   Garlic naan was a bit soggy. Could be better if you ordered it in house.    Raita was flavorless---I'm from Chicago so I've had some really good ones. Wasn't bad. Just not worth the money. Maybe ok if you need to cool down the spice in your meal but not if you're adding flavor.   Overall would have given 5/5 if just judging on the chicken tikka masala, went down to 4 because of raita and naan.

EVDR7fGwxjTY6LsfU5HX9A.text: After searching for six months for the right kind of Indian restaurants that we're used to in New York this place has been just a wonderful place to eat.  What I specially like is the fact that there are so many choices and the food is prepared to perfection. I have been to India twice and I cook Indian food so I know what I'm talking about. I highly recommend this restaurant to anybody that likes Indian food, these are really really really good cooks!

G3c3nksGTaZGojuqX2Tonw.text: This is absolutely my favorite Indian food spot in town.  I take everyone here, and they are always impressed. The service is absolutely warm and friendly.  10/10 would recommend.

ICfUHA4lCsquPxianwXLkQ.text: If you are looking for indian food in the 85016 area, this place is great. The lady who works at the front was very friendly and helped me with selections for my future visit. I tried the chicken Tikka Masala and the Paneer with spinach, both were outstanding. Here are my only complaints (but they wont deter me from coming back because the food was great):  1) they charge for rice 2) the food is pretty pricey  I would come here more often if it was a little bit cheaper, but if I am in the mood to splurge on something out of the ordinary or special this is a good spot. The portions are a reasonable size but still do not justify the expense.

Co_q2zhc-xCbcanqa66Q2g.text: Overall, lunch buffet is REALLY bad and the most expensive across the valley. The rice tasted stale and the tandoori chicken.....man, I don't know what was going on with that but I couldn't stomach more than one bite. The chicken in the other dishes were hard/overcooked. The naan was pretty substandard, as well. They only good food item they had was the dessert rice pudding.  I really wanted to like this place and I would have given it another chance had the lady asking for my feedback at the register handled it appropriately

4fvgzAYvvo6mSqlmDVk_aw.text: This used to be my go-to Indian restaurant. I've been a customer here for ten years and have always come back because of the great food and service. Last night, both the food and the service were sub-par. We ordered the garlic naan, which was inedible due to having so much raw garlic it made my eyes tear. Next, we ordered the vegetable appetizer assortment, of which most was inedible being either burned or too salty. The only item on the plate that was edible were the samosas. The shrimp biryani and shrimp tikka masala were average, with the tikka masala tasting as if it had scorched in the pot. We waited over half an hour for our entrees to appear after getting our appetizers. We had to ask for clean plates for our entrees, because our entree plates held the remains of the garlic naan and appetizers. The waitress never questioned why we didn't eat the garlic naan or the vegetable appetizers. We weren't the only party who received bad service. There were only two other parties in the restaurant at the same time as us, and one of the others had to flag down the waitress to get their check and then again to pay it. It's really hard for me to justify paying a little over $50 for dinner for two, since half of the food was inedible. I won't be back.

_o--cw7PItxWhAWoM25-Wg.text: Hands down best Indian food I've ever had! We had the yellow dal lentils, a cauliflower and potato dish, rice, garlic naan, and potato samosas. The flavors were on hit. Service was great. Very nice people. Definitely highly recommended!

_uSUxV1Mnp49ucGRI3sMkQ.text: The service here is excellent. Everyone is so friendly and welcoming from offering refills, clearing plates, and paying the bill. We stopped in for the lunch buffet and it was ok. I am not a big fan of buffets so I will definitely need to go back and order from the menu. I tried a little bit of everything and left full so that is a good sign. They also brought out a basket of naan for the table which was quite good.

pPjbRbUM4teNYlTjcjYDKw.text: Finally found my Indian place in Central phx!! I love spicy food and this place had some of the best spicy Indian food I've ever had. Staff is great too!

eAnqv37fgoPDpNDrrRRcRQ.text: Food is delicious and staff are friendly and helpful. Not sure about their spicy scale. Based on previous reviews I ordered a "non-vegetable soup" and a lamb vindaloo choosing 8 on their 1-10 scale. Now I like spicy Indian food but the soup was too spicy for me whereas the curry was too mild. Go figure. despite this I would recommend that you eat here.

aV_CnCqF5a2ArJMfxrUBQw.text: It was really good food and the service was excellent...I will definitely return to this place in the future.  The location is centrally located.  It is not super fancy, but the service was so great and the food was even better!

BLREUvtdQx62QDWsvvspUA.text: I've been going to this place for a couple of years now. They have a great variety and had just the right amount of spice for my wife, mother, and aunt. It's a regular place for us to have lunch, now.

2t3ZIhenYgy-XlABT-BXtw.text: 1e weededStopped here for dinner last night, told that it would take 30 minutes. We ordered dinner and an appetizer in anticipation of the wait. After the appetizer came no one checked on us or updated on the progress   of the meal. Finally at 1 hour we went to pay for the appetizer and leave. They tried to convince us to stay.....really 1 hour? Scratch this on off the list.

6kJiJrjQi0DwbCjB4U0V4A.text: Bad restaurant.... Never come again Food was very bad... Don't come here We came from California and owner was so rude

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Very bad restaurant... Came from California and food was like a shit...never go to this place

Uk3oH7a6VHP7cVla6qrS-Q.text: If gas stations sold Indian food, this is what it would taste like.   The Bad I had the Chicken Tikka Masala, the Chicken was tough, the hardest I've ever had. The sauce was watery and I am sure it wasn't made with yogurt. The garlic naan was soggy because they drenched it in a buttery sauce.   The Good The rice and water were ok. The staff was very friendly.   I love Indian food, but this is the worst I ever had.

VCdNm6GT8swSqlZ0L_ZRPQ.text: Very nice atmosphere with a wonderful and knowledgeable waitress. The food was amazing and a large menue with reasonable prices

photos.caption: Photo of Flavors of India - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CNeYwFNfRGjZ3EsujrmN6g.text: Good food...staff was courteous and helpful. I would recommend this place highly. Food was prepared according to the spice level ask d for and we had a variety of spice level in our group, everything cane out good

_6HLX26BsqZ5KUfD7VxsNQ.text: For my first time it was excellent !  Chicken Masala was yummy! I had the buffet which was pretty good. They bring you fresh Naan bread so so good. Mango pudding was delicious.

Y2cPRKweUS4-rCixdZnDlA.text: Now this comes from a foodie Indian..The management just changed...and the food got worse. The food got worse but the service got a little better than earlier. The butter chicken is way off and was sweet and the Buffet wasn't that impressive. Although,I would recommend you go there for the buffet, because of the varieties offered.

YRISXPeJ0cT1VyEk1hBntw.text: Great place for some Indian food. The wait staff is very helpful in explaining what all of the dishes are. The Chicken Tikka Masala is a great beginner plate, and the Mango Lassi is a must. Great place, great experience.

fFSk6ePgMfhoLShQpbt0FA.text: Lunch is a great deal at Flavors of India: buffet style with an excellent variety of food. Dinner is more expensive. Their food is very good except for anything with beef in it. Honestly, you can't expect a culture that believes cows are sacred to know how to cook beef for American diners. Theirs is boiled to the texture of tough shoe leather every time. So, avoid the beef. Everything else is delicious and you can't go wrong.

hAE1VJITBR5AVoHyw42IRA.text: This is the first Indian restaurant we've tried in Phoenix since we moved here from Washington, D.C. I wouldn't say it was the best I've had (nothing tops the Clay Oven restaurant in Frederick, MD-we may be biased because of a huge indian community there), but it was good enough to suit us. We're vegetarians-we ordered the eggplant dish and lentils dish, both which were tasteful.  The naan bread was a bit too crusty compared what we've tried before. The samosas  were unusually small, but good-I liked the spices they used on them.  The huge plus was they put fresh herbs on the dish.  The prices were reasonable for two dishes, and we had plenty to left over to bring home. I was fairly entertained by the Bollywood playing on the tv. (I just LOVE bollywood dancing!).

vZaHNWftkI_xzdXiETRfzg.text: I haven't been to the buffet.  I like the dinner menu a lot, and the Bollywood videos.  Quick tip most Indian restaurants will serve the mild version for us Westerners unless you specifically ask otherwise.  I can't blame them given the bland tastes of most Sonorans.  My mom actually had a conversation with an Indian woman recently about this place.  The woman said that she kept trying other restaurants but kept coming back to this one because of the authenticity.  I consider that a pretty good recommendation.  Although I imagine what is considered "authentic Indian food" varies from one region of India to another.

uNZ2AGudbd8-hi4YKvS13A.text: Let me start by saying I'm not a huge Indian food fan, but I am addicted to their garlic naan, and spicy vegi dal... Mmmmmm.

JW8LtDDK2QKyujpsChCHTg.text: It's fine. The dining area is too dark and the lunch buffet is mediocre. I have a feeling dinner is a better bet than lunch, but haven't had the desire to bother given the mediocre service and lack of options at lunch.

9qHj4_0IcAGZKgbMVQfNqA.text: Have been here about 15 times, and I can offer the following:  affordable,  delicious, and quick/attentive service.  This place has "it".  Just go there, don't delay.

xNjVkruWth2VaH3TV00tNg.text: I'm giving this place a generous 4 stars because the food is actually very tasty. I've been here twice now, and I'm never disappointed. Indian food has to be on the top of my list for favorite cuisines, and I am sad to say there aren't many or any great Indian restaurants that I have found in Phoenix. Flavors of India, however, seems to satisfy my palate. I enjoy the chicken tikka masala every time. I have also tried the curry chicken, which is also very tasty. The chicken is very fresh and tender, both the light and dark meat. The naan is a bit flat and not soft or chewy enough for my taste, but it does its job. I really enjoy their basmati rice. It's not the most elaborate or flavorful I've ever had, but for some reason, I'm drawn to it, and even crave it. There's no saffron or cloves; it's a bit on the simple side, and just a tad bit sticky. The samosas are decent, although I have had better. If you are in the mood for some Indian food, and this place is close by, I suggest you head on over. Prices are reasonable. Two can eat for 30 bucks, including multiple appetizers. The food is prepared quickly. It's not the prettiest of restaurants but it has it's interesting Indian decor with a twist of Mexican thrown in. At least that's my impression. I don't like that they are closed on Sundays, since that's when I typically like to eat Indian food. The quantity is definitely sufficient, and you will have left overs, unless you like to "pig out."   Try it, you'll probably like it!

sKAhKcSgr_qdJZ_AWYkk_Q.text: So I just moved to Phoenix not too long ago and have been trying out new places. I love Indian food, and a friend recommended this place. I'd been to other Indian restaurants here and wasn't too impressed. This place was different.  The food was very good, though since I went for the lunch buffet it probably wasn't as fresh as it would have been ordering from the menu. That said, I saw the staff bring fresh stuff several times and it tasted great. The place smelled just amazing- I think my sweater smelled like Indian food for two days (in a good way!). The staff were very attentive and helpful, even though they were obviously very busy, too. Good service, great food and reasonable prices...what more could I ask for? This place is definitely a keeper!

ZEJheQyQxHkp0FCTmlmHjg.text: Tasty when they haven't run out of food on the buffet. Dirty and full of roaches. I wish I had taken my can of Dow Bathroom Cleaner to spray on the mens room door. Health department says they've take legal action. The employees sit at the bar and drink and talk on cell phones and watch t.v.

ll2vwuFXO7zx8dhR1OM6Cw.text: Recently got take out (chicken kadai and onion kulcha) and was a little disappointed. The meat was a bit fatty which is not OK!!! And, while this is supposed to be a spicier dish, which I would normally love, I found it to be spicy but not entirely flavorful. The onion kulcha was fine. Considering it's proximity to my apartment I may check it out again (perhaps stay away from the meat)?

eChryu0LSoljrJO9bkzTBA.text: Come here for the buffet every once and a while generally bring a coworker or two as I think this place makes for a pretty good introduction to Indian food.  The naan is always hot and fresh, and I haven't tried anything I haven't like yet.  Just leave room for some rice pudding before you go.

Gyl3MEiYjY7xw98e2CYapw.text: I love, love, love this place. The service is always wonderful, the food is consistently delicious, and my husband loves the BollyWood videos. How can you go wrong?

S1dVL2olmC72bi5nKyCy9Q.text: We went with friends who love this place.  Incredibly friendly and patient service that presents fabulous, spicy cuisine from India.  Worth trying for a relaxing and sensational dinner.

qPxyaHFFTyxM34Ry7ICZrg.text: I've never been a fan of Indian food, but I am a fan of Flavors of India Restaurant. When you are met at the door, they make you feel welcome and offer great , friendly service. The atmosphere is peaceful and the wonderful scent of spices is in the air. They make the food to order, so one can have the dishes mild to hot. We go often and it is worth the trip!

NrHuB7rxfl3QG7htPtvr9Q.text: yeah, went back, still AWESOME.  would like to note, though, that i basically only ever go for dinner, so i'm not hip to the lunch situation.
